Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Questgiver's faction +5   Questgiver's associated factions +2 A failed quest (time limit expired) results in a reputation loss according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Questgiver's faction -2   Questgiver's associated factions -1 Enemies[edit] Random dungeon monsters

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to a Merchant or Innkeeper. Transport the package to its recipient in the local town. Beware of burglars looking to take the package from you. Hand over the package within the time limit and collect your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Giving and Receiving[edit] Speak to a Merchant or Innkeeper, who says: "My name is (employer's name). I have a simple task. If you could see your way to delivering an item to a friend of mine, I would be grateful to the tune of (random gold) gold pieces. What do you say, (player's first name)?" or "Hi, I'm (employer's name). I need someone to drop off an item for me. It's a just a short trip across town, but I'm too busy right now. There's (random gold) gold in it for ya." Accept[edit] The merchant or innkeeper goes on: "Great! Here is the package. Take it to (recipient's name) here in town. (He/She) will pay you. It needs to be there by this time tomorrow." or "At last, someone willing to work for a living. Just take this to (recipient's name) here in town. (He/She)'ll give you the (random gold) gold. Get it to (him/her) by this time tomorrow." Decline[edit] The merchant or innkeeper answers: "Too bad." "You don't have to get uppity about it!" "I'll have to find someone willing to work for a living." One-Day Delivery[edit] The burglar overheard you talking to the merchant, and wants the item  You are given a random item, and must deliver to a person in the same town. Your employer will add some detail about the item you are delivering: "This book has some sentimental value. (Recipient's name) has not seen a copy of (book title) in years." "(Recipient's name) needs this (ingredient) for a special brew (he/she) is making." "This (jewelry) is a gift to (recipient's name) that will seal my arrangement with (him/her)." "This is a special (men's clothing) that my mother made for (recipient's name) for the celebration." "(Recipient's name) commissioned this (painting) painting. It needs to be there for (his/her) gathering tomorrow." "(Recipient's name) needs this (liquid ingredient) as soon as possible." "(Recipient's name) has been threatened. This (weapon) should put (his/her) fears to rest." "I bought this fine (women's clothing) for (recipient's name)'s wedding. It would be dreadfully embarrassing if it does not arrive in time." One day should be enough time to complete this task. Ask around in town until you know where the package's recipient can be found, and head to their location. This can be a residence or a shop; depending on the time of day, you may have to wait until the place opens or pick the lock. There is a 25% chance that you will be ambushed by burglars who want to steal the package. When hit, the burglar will say: "I overheard (employer's name) saying (he/she) would pay you to deliver the package. Just give it to me and I won't hurt you." You must deliver the item to the recipient to successfully complete the quest, and obviously, you cannot do that if the burglar steals the item. However, unlike most quests, the burglar will not vanish after taking the item. Thus, you can kill the burglar who took it from you, retrieve the item by looting the corpse, and still deliver it to the recipient successfully. Otherwise, simply refuse any offers from the burglars and run away or fight them off. Reward[edit] Hand over the package to its recipient and collect your reward. Upon obtaining the package, the recipient says: "I was hoping (employer's name) would be able to get this to me in time. (He/She) has been so busy lately. Here is the (random gold) (he/she) promised you." Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] A successfully completed quest results in a reputation gain according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Questgiver's faction +5   Questgiver's associated factions +2 A failed quest (time limit expired) results in a reputation loss according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Questgiver's faction -2   Questgiver's associated factions -1 Enemies[edit] 3x One Burglar every twenty in-game minutes (25% chance) until they have the item, or the quest is over

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to the quest giver of a Temple. Travel to the town named by the quest giver. Deliver the religious item to the priestess within the time limit.
Detailed Walkthrough: Thieves from the rival Temple are willing to attack you in broad daylight Beware the deadly spellswords The priestess has your gold if you have the item  Temple Business[edit] Speak to the quest giver, who says: "Blessings upon you, (player's name). (Temple) needs you to run an errand for us. This (religious item) needs to be delivered to (priestess' name) within (time limit) days. You will receive a temple fee of (random gold) gold pieces. Can you do it for us?" Accept[edit] The quest giver goes on: ""Here is the (religious item). Take it to (priestess' name) of (building) in (town). Oh, I almost forgot to mention that a rival temple may send out thugs to stop you." Decline[edit] The quest giver answers: "Sigh. I shall have to find some other temple servant to perform this task." Finding the Priestess[edit] This quest is a simple delivery task. Travel to the town the quest giver mentioned to you. You may run into a thief or a spellsword on your way, both of whom want to steal the religious item from you, and who shout: "That (religious item) will never make it to (priestess' name). Instead, I shall deliver them your head!" Take care of them if they show up, or flee. Locate the target building, find the priestess inside, and give her the religious item to complete the quest. Reward[edit] Once she has possession of the religious item, the priestess says: "(Temple god)'s favor upon you (player's name). This (religious item) is sorely needed here. I understand that you are to be given a temple fee of (random gold) gold pieces." Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] A successfully completed quest results in a reputation gain according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Deity of the Temple +5   Temple and its associated factions +2 A failed quest results in a reputation loss according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Deity of the Temple -2   Temple and its associated factions -1 Enemies[edit] 2x One Thief every twelve in-game minutes (5% chance) 2x One Spellsword every twelve in-game minutes (5% chance)

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to the quest giver of the Temple of Arkay. Travel to dungeon named by the quest giver. Enter the dungeon, then find and kill the lycanthrope within. Return to the quest giver within the time limit for your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: A Wolf in the Fold[edit] Speak to the quest giver, who says: "As a matter of fact, we could doubtlessly use someone like you. There's a desecrated temple nearby called (dungeon). You may have heard of it. For some time, it has been a home to evil, but we have ignored its influence. It is a counterbalance to other forces, after all. Now the balance has been upset. I need someone to right it. Sound like something you could help with?" or "The Balance in (dungeon) has been unbound by a new intrusion that threatens our efforts at bringing harmony to (region). We need a champion, someone like you, to set (dungeon) to right. Will you do it?" Accept[edit] The quest giver goes on: "Excellent, (player's first name). What we need is to have a certain powerful lycanthrope who has established its lair in that unholy (dungeon) slain. It is threatening the expansion of our order in that area. If you are not back here after (time limit) days have passed, we will move against it ourselves, and your reward will be forfeit. Obviously, you had best be on your way. Fare thee well and best of luck." or "(Oath), that's good, (player's first name). Now, there are but (time limit) days we can give you to restore equilibrium in (dungeon), and the fastest, most appropriate way we know of is for you to slay the lycanthrope who has made its foul nest in (dungeon)'s bowels. Pray hurry, (player's first name). If you are not here when (time limit) suns have set, your reward with be forfeit." Decline[edit] The quest giver answers: "Disappointing. Well, we'll find someone else doubtlessly." Restoring Equilibrium[edit] This quest is a typical dungeon crawl; head to the dungeon named by the quest giver and enter it. Find the lycanthrope, either a wereboar or a werewolf, within. There may be multiple creatures of these types, but you must slay the target creature for the quest to count as a success. When the target creature dies, you receive a notification: You have slain the lycanthrope of (dungeon). Return to the quest giver after the lycanthrope is slain to collect your reward. Reward[edit] When you report back after the lycanthrope has been killed, the quest giver will say: "You have done a great service to the Temple of Arkay, (player's first name). One that will not be forgotten. Enjoy your (random gold) gold -- you certainly deserve it." Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] A successfully completed quest results in a reputation gain according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Deity of the Temple +5   Temple and its associated factions +2 A failed quest results in a reputation loss according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Deity of the Temple -2   Temple and its associated factions -1 Enemies[edit] Random dungeon monsters Quest Target: Any of the following: Wereboar Werewolf

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to the quest giver for House of Dibella or the Order of the Lily. Travel to the town named by the quest giver. Find and meet your contact and get the scarab. Deliver the scarab to the quest giver within the time limit for your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Art House[edit] Speak to the quest giver, who says: "One of the more important functions of the House of Dibella is the preservation of great works of art. We have scouts all over Tamriel who look for rare and beautiful pieces. Are you available to retrieve one such masterpiece? It is not far from here, and we will gladly pay you (random gold) gold pieces for it." or "In over four thousand years of high civilization in Tamriel, the House of Dibella has worked tirelessly to save and preserve objects of antiquity and artistry from ruin at the avaricious and uncouth hands of time. We have developed a sophisticated network of archaeologists, dealers, and couriers who are goodly paid to procure art for the house. Would you assist in one such enterprise, (player's first name)?" Accept[edit] The quest giver goes on: "Oh marvelous. Now, the procurer of this particular work is a rather funny little (contact's description) named (contact's name). What (he/she) has found is apparently so rare and wondrous, (he/she) fears bandits will rob (him/her) before (he/she) gets to our House. I do not know how dangerous it is, but if you would go to (building) in (town) and get the artifact from (him/her), I would be most appreciative. Time is of the essense [sic], for (he/she) says that (he/she) will abandon the artifact if someone is not there to take it in (time limit) days. Meanwhilst, I will expect you back here in (time limit) days. Fare thee well and may Dibella lighten thy load." Decline[edit] The quest giver answers: "Alas, it saddens me that time is considered too precious to spend on that most rare of all pleasures, true beauty." Priceless Objects[edit] Your paranoid contact is in the corner, hiding among the other tavern patrons  Travel to the town named by the quest giver. Ask around to locate your contact's building, and enter it. Depending on the type of building, the door may be locked; come prepared to pick or otherwise bypass the lock. Meet and talk to your contact, who says: "By Dibella, I've been a nervous wreck waitin' for you to show up. Here's the icon -- I'm glad to be rid of it. I can feel every cuthroat's [sic] eyes on on [sic] it. You better get back to the House before they think you ran off with it." With the scarab now in your possession, return to the Temple and deliver it to the quest giver for your reward. You will not encounter any enemies due to this quest. Reward[edit] Upon your return with the scarab, the quest giver says: "It's beautiful! See how the symmetrical lines, the stylized figures, the delicate folds and ornamentation... Oh, (player's first name), what a gift you've given us with this icon. Your (random gold) gold pieces is certainly the least we can offer. Dibella bless you." Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] A successfully completed quest results in a reputation gain according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Deity of the Temple +5   Temple and its associated factions +2 A failed quest results in a reputation loss according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Deity of the Temple -2   Temple and its associated factions -1 Enemies[edit] None

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to a Dark Slayer in a Dark Brotherhood guildhall. Head to the dungeon where the assassin is hiding. Find and kill the assassin within. Find a note on the assassin's corpse. Head to the second dungeon mentioned in the note. Find and kill the assassin's employer within. Return to the Dark Slayer within the time limit to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Upstarts[edit] Speak to a Dark Slayer, who says: "There is another assassination group budding in (region), which must be crushed before it can bloom. I want you to move in, account the assassin, and then the man or woman who ordered the assassination. You do have time for this endeavor, yes?" or "The Dark Brotherhood has been the sole assassin's guild in Tamriel since the Second Era. We intend to keep that monopoly. There is a freelance assassin who has been flaunting us for some time, but (assassin's name)'s luck has ended. I want you to teach (him/her) a permanent lesson, and then repeat the lesson for (his/her) foolish employer. Accept[edit] The Dark Slayer goes on: "Good. Now then, we know that the assassin, (assassin's name), has pursued (his/her) quarry to a dungeon called (dungeon). If you have not found any clues to the employer's wherebouts [sic], return here. I would, of course, prefer for you to account (assassin's name) and (his/her) employer both, but I'd be reasonably satisfied with merely the freelancer's death. Take no longer than (time limit) days for both accountings. Decline[edit] The Dark Slayer answers: "No? How strange and troubling." Retiring the Competition[edit] The assassin's employer brought some backup Travel to the dungeon and enter it. Track down and kill the assassin. There may be multiple enemies of this type within, but you must slay the target for the quest to count as a success. When the assassin dies, a notification appears: You have slain (assassin's name). The Brotherhood will be pleased. Search the assassin's corpse, and you will find a note which reads: After slaying (random name),  go to (employer's dungeon) in  the wilderness of (region)  for your reward.  -- (Employer's name) To locate the assassin's employer, travel to the dungeon mentioned in the note and enter it. Find and kill the employer, a knight, within. Again, there may be multiple enemies of this type in the dungeon, but only one is the quest target. When the employer dies, you receive a notification: (Employer's name) has joined (his/her) employee. The Brotherhood will be pleased. Report back to the guildhall to complete the quest. Reward[edit] If you killed the assassin but not the employer, the Dark Slayer will say: "We would have preferred it if you had accounted (assassin's name)'s boss as well. But it's enough to know that (assassin's name) can no longer be counted as part of the competition." If you killed them both, the Dark Slayer will be more pleased: "Excellent, (player's guild title). We would have been happy with just the termination of (assassin's name), but now the acquaintances of (employer's name) will know that the Dark Brotherhood does not take well to amateur competition." Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] If you did not kill both the assassin and the employer, the quest will count as a failure once the time limit has expired. A successfully completed quest results in a reputation gain according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Dark Brotherhood +5   Dark Slayers +5   Associated factions +2 A failed quest results in a reputation loss according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Dark Brotherhood -2   Dark Slayers -2   Associated factions -1 (Allies/Enemies affiliations for listed factions are not considered in the tables) Enemies[edit] Random dungeon monsters Quest Targets: One Assassin One Knight

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to the Fighter Quester of a Fighters Guild. Head to the town the Fighter Quester mentions. Enter the building and wait until the zombie shows up. Kill the zombie and return to the Fighter Quester within the time limit for your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: 'Til (Un)death...[edit] The widow... ...and her jealous husband  The Fighter Quester says: "Bit of a rummy domestic squabble, (player's first name). Seems that this woman in (town) has asked that someone rid her place of her husband. The only problem is that he is dead. Are you willing to take this on?" Accept[edit] The Fighter Quester goes on: "Her husband is a zombie. He hides out somewhere during day. She never sees him in (building) then. At night he wanders around the place. Put him out of his misery and get back here in (time limit) days, and it's worth (random gold) gold to you." Decline[edit] The Fighter Quester answers: "Too bad. Normally only the temples get jobs like this. You've passed up a good one (player's name)." Getting the Husband Out of the House[edit] Travel to the town the Fighter Quester mentioned and get the location of the building by asking around. The building may be locked depending on the time of day and type of building, so you may need to use an Open spell if the doors are locked. Enter the building and loiter in the house until the zombie appears. The zombie will appear at some time between 19:01 and 4:59. When the zombie is killed, the following message will appear: The zombie is dead. His wife can sleep safely. Reward[edit] Return to the Fighter Quester after killing the zombie and he will say: "Was the old boy as foul smelling as they say? Like a drawer of knickers left in the rain for a month. Well, here is your pay, (player's name)." You will receive the stated amount of gold. Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] A successfully completed quest results in a reputation gain according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Fighters Guild +5   Fighter Questers +5   Associated factions +2 A failed quest results in a reputation loss according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Fighters Guild -2   Fighter Questers -2   Associated factions -1 (Allies/Enemies affiliations for listed factions are not considered in the tables.) Enemies[edit] Quest Target: One Zombie

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to a Quester of your Knightly Order. Head to the dungeon where the "dragon" has been spotted. Find and kill a dragonling. Report back to the Quester within the time limit.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Hatchling[edit] Speak to the Quester, who says: "Shhh! Don't let anyone else hear this, (player's guild title). I just got word that a dragon has been spotted! Well, not a full grown dragon, just a little dragonling. There is no quest more heroic for a member of (faction) than to slay a dragon. I know where it is, you go kill it. We can both lay claim to the glory. Is it a bargain?" or "Tis time for you to prove that you are truly of (faction), (player's guild title). It is time for you to slay a dragon." Accept[edit] The Quester goes on: "The dragon egg just hatched in (dungeon). I don't know if there are any other dragonlings there or not. I can keep it all a secret for (time limit) days." Decline[edit] The Quester answers: "You tell anyone else about this and I'll see you drummed out of (faction)." Dragonling Rising[edit] Head to the dungeon where the dragonling was spotted. Find the dragonling and kill it. Depending on your level, there may be more than the one you are looking for. However, when you have found and slain the quest target, you will get a notification: The dragonling is dead. They'll talk about this in (faction) for years! Reward[edit] Upon your return, the Quester heralds: "All hail (player's name), known from this point onward as a dragonslayer! All hail (Quester's name), strong right arm and valued confidant!" Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] A successfully completed quest results in a reputation gain according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Generic Knightly Order -2   Knight Order -2  Enemies[edit] Random dungeon monsters Quest Target: One Dragonling

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to the quest giver at a Thieves Guild hall. Travel to another town and meet your contact, or: Receive a letter during your journey via a delivery boy. Head to the town mentioned in the letter. Meet the new contact at the location mentioned in the letter. Give either contact the drugs within the time limit and collect your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Mule Run[edit] Speak to the quest giver, who says: "(Player's first name), I got a job for you if you're interested. A little package needs delivering to (first town). What do you say?" Accept[edit] The quest giver goes on: "Great. Here's the package, some (drugs). It needs to be in (first town) as soon as possible. (First contact's name) will meet you there in (first building). Be careful. If word of this shipment leaks out, we may have a bit of trouble with some freelance smugglers who think they own the business in (region). Decline[edit] The quest giver answers: "Don't do me any favors, pal." Making the Drop[edit] Travel to the town where your contact waits. There are two possible scenarios: If you manage to make it to the meeting place within one to about three days, your contact will take the drugs from you and give you the promised reward. If you can't reach the meeting place within this period of time, your contact will leave. You will then be approached: A small, dirty boy tugs on your sleeve. He hands you a scrap of paper then dashes off down an alley. Read the letter: (Player's name) Sorry I couldn't meet you in (first town) as planned. The heat got too intense for me to wait around. I've arranged an alternate drop in (second town). Look for a (second contact's description) waiting for you in (second building). Watch your back, (First contact's name) Travel to the town mentioned in the letter. Along the way, you may encounter a rival group of smugglers who will attack you on sight. When hit, the first of these will say: "When are you Thieves Guild thugs going to learn that we control the (drugs) business around (region)?" Deal with them and learn the location of your new contact by asking around in town. Find and speak to the contact to hand over the drugs and collect your reward. Reward[edit] When you give the drugs to either of the two contacts, they will say: "I'm glad you made it through. These amateurs don't stand a chance against our organization.  Here's (random gold) gold for your services. Good work."

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to a Merchant or an Innkeeper. Head to the tavern your challenger points you to. Be there before the time limit expires and wait for your opponent. Kill your adversary and collect the loot from his/her body.
Detailed Walkthrough: Taking Offense[edit] Speak to a merchant or innkeeper, who will say one of the following: "Excuse me! Can't you see I'm busy you smelly (player's race). Are you looking for trouble or something?" "What? What did you say? I hope I didn't hear you say something. Did you say something?" "Well excuse me. Didn't want to get in your way you fat (player's race) pig. You want to step outside?" "Can't you see I'm busy! And not in a good mood I might add! If you don't leave now, there could be trouble. Is that what you want?" Accept[edit] The merchant or innkeeper goes on: "Oh ... you want to play, do you?" "I think we've got a live one!" "Well ... looks like my day just got more interesting!" "You really are as stupid as you look! Fine, (player's race), I'll play too." "So that's the way you want it! I'm game to any (player's race)!" Decline[edit] The merchant or innkeeper answers: "That's more like it, now shove off." "I didn't think so, go on with whatever you do." "Didn't think you would say yes anyway. Now begone with yourself." Tough Talk[edit] Unlike other quests, accepting brings up more dialogue and another chance to decline the quest: "This could get ugly, not as ugly as you, but I have no problem cutting your head off for such words! You want this to turn into a battle do ya?" "You're lookin' for a fight aren't you? Is that what you want, child?" "Oh ... we do have a live one ... with weapons! You want to use that on me?" "The two fights I got into yesterday didn't end well for the other pigs! You want to take me on, do ya?" That Escalated Quickly[edit] Accept again, and receive a third dialogue, with one more chance to bow out: "Oh, smelly one. 'Tis not your lucky day. How about a duel?" "Then we shall settle this like warriors. What do you say to a duel?" "I settle my arguments the old way. How about a duel?" "We'll settle this one. At least, I will! How about a duel later?" Challenge Accepted![edit] Agree to a duel and the quest giver will gleefully respond: "Excellent! Ha ha! A duel it is. But not here, pig. Six hours from now, at (inn). I'll see you there." "A bad decision, (player's race). The duel is on then. Meet me at (inn) in six hours. I'll be waiting!" "Don't push too hard. Effort like that killed a horse of mine ... and it may kill you! Meet me at (inn) and we'll settle this. Be there in six hours. I must prepare." "A duel it is! You'll be sorry... but you had your chance to keep walking. Meet me at (inn) in six hours and we'll settle this one." Changing Your Mind[edit] If you decline the second or third time, the belligerent quest giver will say: "I didn't think so. Now shove off." "That's more like it. Now leave me." "Now we see who you are. Goodbye." "Pass on by then. I don't have time to waste on you." "Then move along. I have a busy day ahead." Defending You Honor[edit] Your opponent honorably sent a hired goon to the fight instead You are given a time and place for the duel; you will meet your opponent at a local tavern six hours after accepting the challenge. Head to the tavern in time and loiter there if you are too early. The merchant or innkeeper will not show up, but will instead send a henchmen, a spellcaster or warrior type, to fight you. Upon being hit, your adversary will taunt you with: "Then the (player's race) is not a coward as (employer's name) said you were. (He/She) paid me well to come here and cut you to pieces. And I shall. Prepare for battle!" "It is you! (Employer's name) said you would be here, and I always finish (his/her) fights." "You should watch who you mess with. (Employer's name) has many friends. Now prepare to die!" Kill the goon and a message pops up: As you gaze down on your fallen adversary, you know that your honor has been satisfied. Collect any loot you find from the body. Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] A successfully completed quest results in a reputation gain according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Questgiver's faction +5   Questgiver's associated factions +2 A failed quest (time limit expired) results in a reputation loss according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Questgiver's faction -2   Questgiver's associated factions -1 Enemies[edit] Quest Target: One Spellsword

Quick Walkthrough: About thirty days after freeing Medora, receive a vision from the sorceress. Travel to Orsinium and ask Gortwog about the Dust of Restful Death. Travel to the dungeon on the Isle of Balfiera named by Gortwog and search for the Dust within. Locate the Dust and a letter on a mummy within the dungeon. Return the Dust and letter to Medora, who will provide additional insight into King Lysandus' assassination and begin preparing the Dust of Restful Death for use.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Sorceress and the Orc[edit] About a month after completing Medora's Freedom, you receive an informative vision from the sorceress: Your vision hazes and the world grows dim. Out of the gray, a woman's face appears. Medora! "(Player's first name). Your efforts to free me have not been in vain. I have discovered a powder that will soothe the ghost of my beloved Lysandus. However, it is in the hands of Gortwog, Warlord of the Orcs, in his steel citadel of Orsinium. Go to him in Orsinium and see if there is anything that can be done to persuade him to give it to you. Bring the powder to me in Direnni Tower once you have it." The vision clears. Sometimes you wish sorceresses would just send letters like other folks do. Take care of any pressing business and head to Orsinium to meet with Gortwog as soon as possible. Speak to him, and he says: "So Medora wants the Dust of Restful Death. Only because I respect the memory of King Lysandus will I do this. The Dust can be found in (dungeon) on her own island. Tell Medora that the price is her support of my claim to the heart. She'll know what it means." Finding the Dust of Restful Death[edit] The Dust of Restful Death is carried by a mummy in the dungeon Gortwog points you to. While this can be any random crypt on the Isle of Balfiera, there is a very high chance that this dungeon will be The Masoleum of Darkivaron. If so, click the link for a walkthrough. If not, carry out your search as any standard dungeon crawl. After locating and slaying the mummy, search its corpse to find a packet of midnight black powder wrapped in parchment. Unwrapping the parcel reveals the parchment to be the remains of a letter from Gortwog to Medora: This parchment was used as a wrap for the packet of powder. Some of its message is now illegible. Lady Med... ...favor. They intend to slay him. I am sending ........ers to stop them. You must support me. If the empire finds I have attacked royal advisers of Wayr......ven if they are assassins, my people will never win the same status and respect as the Khaji................ians. However, with your support I c............. a hero of the empire, and win respect for my people. Gortwog Warl... Return to Medora[edit] Even though the letter is half gone, it still presents some interesting information. Now that you have the items, return to Medora. Make your way once again to her chamber in Direnni Tower and speak to her. She says: "This is indeed the Dust of Restful Death. As for that letter, it was from Gortwog to me, though I never got it. I heard from him later that his orc warriors were slain attempting to ambush the assassins. Gortwog and his orcs are not the villains most people seem [sic] them as." "Eadwyre and the court of Wayrest have never been particularly loyal to the empire. To assassinate a king is treason. I will have my revenge, but first I must find out why Eadwyre would risk this." "I will need a month to prepare the Dust. Come back to me at that time and I will give it to you, along with instructions for its use." There is nothing more you can do at this time but wait for Medora to prepare the Dust of Restful Death. This takes approximately 21 days, after which you can return to her for the next quest. Enemies[edit] Random dungeon Monsters Quest Target: One Mummy

Quick Walkthrough: Receive a threatening letter. Find a letter from Princess Elysana in your inventory. Meet Elysana at Castle Wayrest and talk to her. Escort Elysana's "Cousin" to a random town in the Iliac Bay. Fight off any enemies that attempt to ambush you. Meet the contact and collect your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Prelude[edit] Shortly after you have received any of the letters revealing the true nature of the Totem of Tiber Septim, you will receive a delivery: A street urchin races up calling "Message for (player's name) from the man in gray." The child runs off before you can grab him, leaving you holding a note. Find the note in your inventory. It reads: (Player's first name),  If you don't want to be dead as  Lysandus, stop your investigations  immediately. Do you really want to  risk your life for a dead man?  You are being watched. From this moment on, you may be periodically attacked by knights and barbarians, each holding a copy of this mysterious note, and sometimes another which reads: Kill (player's name) before too much is  learned. Use any means.   -- W. This goes on for seven to fourteen days, after which a letter appears in your inventory. It was sent by Princess Elysana of Wayrest, and reads: (Player's name),  My good friend Lord Woodborne says  you are a hero that can be trusted.  I would be truly indebted to you if  you would stop by some time to chat.  Maybe you could even do something  for me. I would be oh so grateful. Princess Elysana Castle Wayrest This quest is entirely optional, and the random attacks will cease after you have survived enough of them. But should you wish to follow up on Elysana's invitation, head to Castle Wayrest for a "chat". A Chat with Elysana[edit] Elysana's cousin Once inside the castle, find and speak to Princess Elysana. She exclaims: "You are even more dashing in person than Lord Woodborne said. I just love talking to men and women of action! I know that you're looking for a certain object, (player's first name). A totem pole or something? Well, an acquaintance of mine, a perfectly delightful (contact's description), has something that may help you. If you would escort my cousin (cousin's name) to (contact's name) you can have it. Would you do this teensy weensy favor for me?" Accept[edit] Elysana goes on: "How exciting! It will be a real adventure. (Cousin's name) just loves to travel and has been dying to spend some time with (contact's name). Go to (town) of (town's region), to a place called (contact's residence). (he/she [sic]) will pay you (random gold) gold pieces for bringing (him/her) (cousin's name). Don't you just love these dangeous [sic] missions?" Decline[edit] Elysana replies, disappointed: "No? How dreadful! My poor cousin will be so disappointed. You are not nearly as fun as Lord Woodborne said you would be." Escorting the Cousin[edit] Be prepared to fend off barbarian ambushes Elysana's acquaintance will always be a "majestic orc" (see bugs) Escort the cousin (who is now following you) to the destination town named by Elysana. The town is located in whichever region you were in when the quest began—that is, when you received any of the letters regarding the Totem and Numidium as a result of the previous quest. Again, you may encounter barbarians and knights on your journey, provided they have not already shown up long before your chat with Elysana. After you have killed a couple of ambushers, Elysana's cousin will cryptically interject: (Cousin's name) says "Who were those barbarians? They almost killed you! Maybe you should just forget about Lysandus' ghost." If you have slain five attackers and are not in fast-travel mode, the cousin flees at sundown: (Cousin's name) says "You're much tougher than Elysana said you would be." (Cousin's name) suddenly runs away, (his/her) feet making no sound as (he/she) disappears into the shadows. Regardless of the situation, continue to your destination. Ask around to locate the contact's residence, then enter it and speak to him for your reward. Reward[edit] Speak to the contact; his response depends on whether the cousin is with you or not. If so, the contact greets you with: "(Player's first name)! How did...I mean, I'm glad to see you. And (cousin's name) too. Here take the gold. Object? What's a totem? Well, its [sic] been nice talking to you. Gotta run!" If the cousin has run off, the contact has a more interesting tale to tell: "(Player's first name), it wasn't my fault! I was hired to set you up! Here, take the (random gold) gold. Some guy in a gray cloak paid me exactly that much to do it. (Cousin's name) was just some whore paid to go with you. You know, I just remembered. I have (bribe gold) gold pieces that are just too heavy to carry anymore. Why don't you take them and I'll just be going." Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] As soon as you accept the quest your reputation will drop as shown below. Additionally, you will not gain any reputation in the end. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Wayrest -25   Elysana -25   Associated Factions -13 Enemies[edit] 10x One Barbarian seventy in-game minutes (10% chance) until you kill at least three of them 10x One Knight ninety-one in-game minutes (10% chance) until you kill at least two of them

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Princess Elysana at Castle Wayrest. Get a robe from her. Deliver it to Lord Castellian in his cottage. Return to Elysana within the time limit and collect your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Princess' Request[edit] Once you have reached level 6, speak to Princess Elysana in Castle Wayrest, who will say: "Hello, (player's first name). I am Elysana, King Eadwyre's child and heir apparent to Wayrest. Perhaps you could help me out of a bit of an embarrassing predicament. The senior member of the elder council, my father's good friend Lord Castellian, has left court on holiday and I forgot to return a cloak I borrowed from him. If it isn't too much of a bore to you, would you mind bringing it to him in (town)? I could offer you a lovely (jewelry) as payment. Accept[edit] Elysana continues: "How frightfully nice of you to help a silly girl like myself. Here's the robe. Now, it's very important that milord Castellian has the robe soon. He is at one of his houses, (residence) in (town). Lord Castellian shouldn't be too hard to find, just ask around for him or for (residence) and give him the robe. I do really appreciate this, (player's first name). It really shouldn't take you longer than (time limit) days to get to (town) and back, so I'll see you then." Decline[edit] Elysana replies: "No? Oh, (oath)." Locating Lord Castellian[edit] Lord Castellian The daedra may not appear threatening at first... ...but looks can be deceiving Lord Castellian's minions will be angry at your involvement With the robe now in your possession, make your way to the town where Lord Castellian is on retreat. Ask around to locate his residence, and enter it. Find the nobleman and speak to him to deliver the robe, and hear something strange along with his reply: "A gift from Lady Elysana. Thank you, (player's name). It fits me like a glove." You feel a tearing sound, as if the fabric of reality were being ripped open. The source of the strange noise becomes apparent as Lord Castellian is set upon by up to three Daedra Seducers, who have no problem going through you to get to him. When one is hit for the first time, she says: "Leave this place litte [sic] (player's race). We have come to claim Lord Castellian. You have done your part by delivering his funeral shroud which summoned us." You can fight them off if you wish, but you ultimately cannot prevent the death of the lord. At this point, your task is complete. All that remains is to return to Elysana. However, you will be pursued by legions of Castellian's knights and spellswords, furious at you for your part in their patron's grisly demise. When hit, the first of these will shout one of: "Death to the traitor that assasinated [sic] Lord Castellian!" "You shall pay for killing my liege lord." "Assassin! Lord Castellian was the best of men. You shall die for what you did." Fight or flee, and return to Castle Wayrest. (Optional) Wearing the Robe[edit] So long as you have not yet delivered it, you are free to try on the robe. However, it means that you will be immediately set upon by a trio of Daedra Seducers, who when hit will say: "Fool! Some enterprising soul has given you a robe that summoned me to slay you. How delicious!" The robe will vanish if you slay all three Seducers, presumably returning to Oblivion with them. This makes the quest impossible to complete, as you now have nothing to bring to Lord Castellian. However, so long as one of the Daedra Seducers remains alive, you can proceed with the quest and deliver the robe to Lord Castellian as normal, though you will have to deal with three more Seducers once he puts on the robe. Reward[edit] Return to Castle Wayrest and speak to Elysana, who greets you by saying: "Oh, how marvelous you are. Here, let me give you the (jewelry) I promised you. I hope Lord Castellian appreciates the extra work I put into the robe. It is a real attention getter now. Let me give you something more than the (jewelry), (player's first name). My father is very interested in a certain ancient relic called the Totem of Tiber Septim. He has spies all over the place looking for it. When they find it, my father will need someone to secure it. Obviously, whoever he chooses will be fabulously well rewarded. I'll give him your name. That is the least I can do."  Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] If you successfully deliver the robe to Lord Castellian, you will gain reputation according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Wayrest +10   Princess Elysana +10   Associated Factions +5 (Allies/Enemies affiliations for listed factions are not considered) Enemies[edit] 3x One Daedra Seducer every one in-game minute (50% chance) if you give the robe to Lord Castellian 4x Two Knights every two in-game minutes (50% chance) as soon as Lord Castellian is attacked by the Daedra Seducers 20x Two Spellswords every fifty-three in-game minutes (15% chance) after Lord Castellian was killed by the Daedra Seducers 3x One Daedra Seducer every one in-game minute (20% chance) if you use the robe

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to Mynisera at Castle Daggerfall after completing Cyndassa's quest. (Optional) Speak to Queen Aubk-i about the letter. Find the Knights of the Dragon agent to get the name and the whereabouts of the emperor's courier. Meet the courier to talk about the letter. Report back to Mynisera.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Dowager Queen[edit] After completing Cyndassa's quest, enter the room directly to the right of the stairs in the main throne room of Castle Daggerfall. Inside you will find the former queen, Mynisera. Speak to her, and she will say: "Hello (player's name). I have heard much about you. Now you come to me with a very interesting tale of deception. So Cyndassa the maid says that Aubk-i opened a letter from the emperor addressed to me. I can tell you (player's first name), that she never delivered such a letter to me. I would like you to investigate this further, (player's name). It could be dangerous to poke into the affairs of Aubk-i without enraging King Gothryd, even though he is my own son. Are you willing?" Accept her offer, and she will continue: "Good. I have long had my suspicions about Aubk-i's loyalty to the emperor. She is a daughter of the late King Cameron [sic], who ruled Hammerfell from his citidel [sic] in Sentinel. My husband King Lysandus, (random god) rest his soul, died at Cryngaine, as did King Cameron. Lysandus [sic] body was not recovered, so he has a monument erected there rather than a true tomb. Ah...my mind wanders. The emperor uses (courier's name) as his messenger in Daggerfall. (He/She) could be anywhere in the region delivering missives. However, (courier's name) is a member of the Knights of the Dragon. Go to (knight's building) in (knight's town) and ask for (knight's name). (He/She) may know where to find (courier's name). Try to find out why a letter addressed to me was delivered to Aubk-i." Mynisera will give you a signet ring to identify yourself to your contacts as one of her agents. Confronting Queen Aubk-i[edit] The queen seems rather abashed when questioned about the letter If you decide to question Aubk-i about the letter, she will say: "The letter from the Emperor? Actually (player's name) this is rather embarrassing. The letter was stolen from me the same day I received it. I never did read it. I have been hoping that the letter would turn up, or the [sic] the Emperor would send another letter. If you find the letter, I would be most grateful if you would let me personally deliver it to Mynisera." Questioning the Queen will severely lower your reputation with her and Daggerfall. She will also send nightblades after you periodically to prevent you from snooping any further. As a result, it is recommended that you avoid speaking to her until the quest is complete.  A Knight on the Town[edit] The Knights of the Dragon dispatcher serving as your contact Once you leave the castle, go to the town Mynisera told you about and ask around to learn the location of the building where your contact is waiting. Once you locate the building, speak to your contact, who will say: "I am (knight's name). I would not normally tell anyone who is not a Knight of the Dragon where to find (courier's name). However, I am loyal to Queen Mynisera. I also know that (courier's name) disemboweled the last person that tried to ambush (him/her). In (time limit) days (he/she) is due to be at (palace) in (palace town). Try (him/her) there."  Finding the Courier[edit] The Emperor's Courier Travel to the town your contact mentioned and look for the palace. The emperor's courier will arrive in the palace on the specified day and remain there for two days afterwards. Enter the palace and speak to the courier, who will say: "Ho! You should be warned that I am a Knight of the Dragon in the service of the Emperor himself. If this is some ruse to ambush me, you will surely not live to regret it. Hmmm. Yes, I am (courier's name). This signet ring proves that you are indeed in the service of Mynisera. Some time ago I delivered a letter from the Emperor addressed to the Queen of Daggerfall. If I am not mistaken, Aubk-i is Queen of Daggerfall, not Mynisera. Tell Mynisera that I take my duties quite seriously. I would never knowingly deliver a missive to the wrong party. Queen Aubk-i gave me this (jewelry) in gratitude. Show it to Mynisera so that she may know I am a loyal servant and faithful to my Order."  Report Your Findings[edit] Return to Mynisera in Castle Daggerfall and she will say: "Ah! Now it makes sense. Uriel Septim addressed the message to the Queen of Daggerfall. When he sent it, I was queen. By the time it arrived, my dear Lysandus was dead and Aubk-i was queen. We must find out what was in that letter. I have never trusted Aubk-i. Yesterday I received a letter from Princess Morgiah of Wayrest claiming to know something of the emperor's letter. Now there is a family that seethes under the rule of the Emperor. Return to me if you find out who has the emperor's letter. For now, you have proven yourself to me (player's name). Keep the (jewelry) as a token of my gratitude. I have no desire to own anything of Aubk-i's anymore." Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] If you report back to Mynisera after you have met the courier, you will gain reputation according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Daggerfall +10   Queen Aubk-i ±0   Mynisera +15   Lord Bridwell +15   Associated factions +10 If you question Queen Aubk-i about the emperor's letter, you will lose reputation according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Daggerfall -10   Queen Aubk-i -10   Court of Daggerfall -10   Associated factions -5 (Allies/Enemies affiliations for listed factions are not considered) Enemies[edit] 10x One nightblade every 500 in-game minutes (50% chance) if you question Queen Aubk-i about the letter

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to a noble. Travel to the town where the noble pawned the ring. Visit the specified pawn shop during its open hours. Purchase the ring with the noble's gold. Return the ring to the noble within the time limit for your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: The noble hocked the ring at a regional pawn shop The pawnbroker is willing to deal for the gold These knights do not care who gets in their way of the ring  Pawn Broken[edit] "I'm in rather a delicate situation, (player's first name). If I could count on your diligence and your silence, you could earn yourself, say, (random gold) gold pieces profiting on my misery. Sound enticing?" Accept[edit] The noble goes on: "Well, that's good anyway. Not long ago, during a time of financial stagnancy, I pawned a ring given to me by the Emperor himself. I figured that Uriel Septim never makes it down to this corner of the Empire, but now I hear his agents are in the area, and I must have to have that ring back. (Pawnbroker's name), of (pawn shop) in (town), will only hold it for (time limit) more days. Here's the gold to pay for the ring. Good luck and (random god) speed your journey." Decline[edit] The noble answers: "(Oath), blast, and (oath)! I'm surrounded by apathetic lazybones! Nothing personal, (player's first name)." Getting the Ring Out of Hock[edit] The noble gives you a piece of gold to buy back the ring. Travel to the specified town and visit the pawn shop during its open hours. Find the target in the shop, speak to them and exchange the gold for the ring. The pawnbroker will say: "You must be (player's first name). You're lucky you made it when you did. I was about to sell the ring to a very eager third party. Well, if I understand correctly and (noble's name) wants the ring before the Imperial statesmen arrive, you better be on your way. You only have a very little time." With the ring in your possession, head back to the noble. On your way back you may be accosted by some knights who want to take the ring from you. Attack, a knight and be told: "Give me the ring. This can go easy or hard. It's really up to you. Either way, we get the ring." Kill the knights; returning without the ring means you fail the quest, and this will cost you an extreme amount of reputation. Also, if you surrender the ring the knight goes on to say: "Fool. Now you will die. Did you really think we would let a witness live?" Once you are able, return to the noble right away. Reward[edit] When you return the ring, the noble will thank you by saying: "Oh good, oh good, the ring. Oh thank you, thank you, (player's first name). Here's the (random gold) gold pieces I promised. An expensive delivery, but truly worth every piece." Quick Walkthrough: Talk to the quest giver of a Temple. Travel to the town named by the quest giver. Deliver the religious item to the priestess within the time limit.
Detailed Walkthrough: A thief emerges from the crowd and attacks The rival Temple may also send a spellsword after you The priestess waits patiently for the item  Deliverance[edit] The quest giver says: "Blessings upon you, (player's name), even though you are a heathen and do not patronize our temple. I am (quest giver's name). So you are looking to curry favor with (temple). Deliver this (religious item) to (town) within (time limit) days and I can speak well of you." Accept[edit] The quest giver goes on: ""Here is the (religious item). Take it to (priestess' name) of (building) in (town). Oh, I almost forgot to mention that a rival temple may send out thugs to stop you." Decline[edit] The quest giver answers: "It is your loss. Ask not for the favor of this temple any time soon, (player's name)." Finding the Priestess[edit] This quest is a simple delivery task. Travel to the town the quest giver mentioned to you. You may run into a thief or a spellsword on your way, both of whom want to steal the religious item from you, and who shout: "That (religious item) will never make it to (priestess' name). Instead, I shall deliver them your head!" Take care of them if they show up, or flee. Locate the target building, find the priestess inside, and give her the religious item to complete the quest. Reward[edit] Once she has possession of the religious item, the priestess says: "The god's favor upon you (player's name). This (religious item) is sorely needed here." Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] A successfully completed quest results in a reputation gain according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Deity of the Temple +5   Temple and its associated factions +2 A failed quest results in a reputation loss according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Deity of the Temple -2   Temple and its associated factions -1 If you don't deliver the religious item in time, you will lose an overall amount of reputation as shown in the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Deity of the Temple -7   Temple and its associated factions -3 Enemies[edit] 2x One Thief every twelve in-game minutes (5% chance) 2x One Spellsword every twelve in-game minutes (5% chance)

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to a Merchant or an Innkeeper. Escort your employer to the indicated destination town. Be prepared for an ambush there. Turn over or defend your employer. Escort your employer to the destination building within the time limit and collect your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: The guards have a warrant, at least The Mages Guild searches for your employer You may have to sneak past the Thieves Guild The Dark Brotherhood takes their contracts seriously  Escort Service[edit] Speak to a merchant or innkeeper, who greets you with one of: "I am (employer's name). I am in need of an escort. Would you protect me on my journey to (destination town)? It's less less than (time limit) days from here." "My name is (employer's name). I have to get out of (current town) right away. I want to hire you to guard me on my journey to (destination town). I can pay you (random gold) gold pieces." "You have to help me! My name is (employer's name). I need to get to (destination town) within (time limit) days and I need an escort." Accept[edit] The merchant or innkeeper goes on: "Blessings upon you (player's name). I travel light, so I'm ready to go. I know you don't work for free. Take me to (building) in (destination town) and I'll pay you (random gold) gold when we get there." Decline[edit] The merchant or innkeeper answers: "I guess I'll have to find someone else to protect me on my journey." or "Heartless oaf!" Protecting the Employer[edit] Escort your employer to the destination town. When you arrive, you will be ambushed by a faction that is interested in capturing your employer. There are four possible groups that can be after you: warriors from the Town Guards, Mages Guild mages, thieves representing the Thieves Guild, or assassins belonging to the Dark Brotherhood. Each has a 25% chance of appearing as the ambushing faction. Depending on which faction is after your employer, your attackers will say when hit: Town Guards: "Halt! I have a warrant for the arrest of (employer's name) in the name of (region). We don't want you, just (him/her). Turn (him/her) over and you can go free. Mages Guild: "There is no need for us to fight. Our quarrel is with (employer's name). The Mages Guild does not accept treachery lightly. Give (him/her) to us and you can be on your way. Thieves Guild: "Out of the way (player's race). We want (employer's name), and you can't stop us. Just turn (him/her) over. Hey, (employer's name). You didn't think you could cheat the Thieves Guild and live, did you?" Dark Brotherhood: "Stand aside, (player's race). (Employer's name) is wanted by the Dark Brotherhood. You aren't such a fool as to try to protect (him/her), are you?" This will be followed by: (Employer's name) says, "Ha! I hired this (player's race) to protect me from this. (Player's name), are you going to turn me over?" If you hand over your employer your opponents will cease attacking you, but you will be unable to complete your given objective. Thus, the quest will end here. Immediately following this, another message pops up: (Employer's name) is slain right before your eyes. If you choose to defend your companion, the attacker replies: "Have it your way. Kill them both!" Fight off any enemies and loot the corpses if you wish, then proceed to the target building to complete your mission. Note that whatever choice you make here could be considered both success and failure; depending on which faction is after you, it may be to your advantage to betray your employer. If you manage to get your employer into the destination building without engaging your pursuers, your reputation with them will not be touched. However: If you turn your employer over to the ambushing faction, you naturally won't receive any reward or gain reputation with your employer's faction. The quest will count as a failure three hours after you have surrendered your employer to the pursuers. You will, however, gain 10 reputation with the ambushing faction and 5 reputation with its associated factions. If you don't turn your employer over when you are commanded to do so, you will lose 20 reputation with the ambushing faction and 10 reputation with its associated factions. Reward[edit] When you enter the destination building, your employer parts ways, saying: "Ah! (Building)! You have fulfilled your part of the bargain. Here is the gold I promised you." However, if you fail to make it to your destination in time, your employer leaves in a huff without paying you: "Are you lost, (player's name)? I guess I'll have to find my own way to (destination town). Thanks for nothing, worthless wretch." Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] A successfully completed quest results in a reputation gain according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Questgiver's faction +5   Questgiver's associated factions +2 A failed quest (time limit expired) results in a reputation loss according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Questgiver's faction -2   Questgiver's associated factions -1 Additional Reputation[edit] If your employer is wanted by the Town Guards, your actions will influence your Regional Reputation as shown in the table below. Action Regional Reputation Gain   Turn him over +10   Don't turn him over -20 If you turn your employer over to one of the other factions, you will gain reputation according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Persecutors' faction +10   Persecutors' associated factions +5   Questgiver's faction -2   Questgiver's associated factions -1 If you defend your employer you will lose reputation according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Persecutors' faction -20   Persecutors' associated factions -10 Enemies[edit] Town Guards: 5x Two Warriors every five in-game minutes (20% chance) until the quest is over Mages Guild: 3x Two Mages every five in-game minutes (25% chance) until the quest is over Dark Brotherhood: 3x Two Assassins every five in-game minutes (25% chance) until the quest is over Thieves Guild: 3x Two Thieves every five in-game minutes (25% chance) until the quest is over

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to a noble. Travel to the town named by the noble. Talk to the spy and give her the telescope. Travel to the town named by the spy. Meet your contact there. Give him/her the relic. Collect your reward. Be sure to follow the time limits.
Detailed Walkthrough: The spy, cleverly hiding behind a tavern patron Spies Like Us[edit] Speak to a noble, who says: "If you have a couple days to spare and wouldn't mind being (random gold) gold pieces richer, I have a mission requiring some speed and delicacy." Accept[edit] The noble goes on: "Excellent, (player's first name). Now, I have a spy, (spy's name) in (first town) who needs a telescope to continue (his/her) surveillance activities. I am given to understand (he/she) has found something of interest to a mutual friend of ours, which needs to be delivered as well. So, here is the telescope. Take it to a (spy's description) in a place called (first building) in (first town), and there you will get further instructions. Good luck to you, (player's first name)." Decline[edit] The noble answers: "No? I wasn't expecting you to turn down (random gold) gold for a few days work. How many peasants would murder for that kind of money? Ah, well. Your life, I suppose." Making Deliveries[edit] A relic The relic's recipient  This is a simple quest; there will be no enemies to stop you. Just travel quickly to the spy, hand over the telescope, then deliver the relic to the contact in the second town in time. Speak to the spy and be told: "Excellent timing, (player's first name). Allow me to introduce myself. My name is (spy's name) and I believe that's my telescope you're carrying. (Noble's name), I believe, told you I would have a little job for you. Take this relic over to a (contact's description) in (second town). The name's (contact's name) and you'll find (him/her) at (second building). Your gold will be waiting for you there as well. Be better be on your way; (he/she) expects you there in (second time limit) days." Travel to the second town and ask around to locate the contact's building. Enter it, and deliver the relic for your reward. Reward[edit] When you deliver the item, the contact says: "You must be (player's name). (Spy's name) told me to expect you. I am (contact's name). Let me have a look at that relic. Very interesting indeed. Well, here's your (random gold) gold pieces. You never saw me, got it?" Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] A successfully completed quest results in a reputation gain according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Noble you got the quest from -22   Noble's associated factions -11   Oblivion and all associated Daedra Princes +1   Sheogorath -1   The Night Mother +1   The Dark Brotherhood and its associated factions +1   Ebonarm -1   The Order of Arkay and its associated factions -1   The Benevolence of Mara and its associated factions -1   The Akatosh Chantry and its associated factions -1   The School of Julianos and its associated factions +1   The House of Dibella and its associated factions -1   The Temple of Stendarr and its associated factions +1   The Mages Guild and its associated factions -1   The Thieves Guild and its associated factions +1   Random Ruler -1   Daggerfall and its associated factions -1   Sentinel and its associated factions -1   Wayrest and its associated factions -1   The King of Worms and The Necromancers -1   The Underking and his Agents -1   Orsinium and its associated factions -1   The Glenmoril Witches -1   The Dust Witches +1   The Daughters of Wroth +1   The Witches of the Marsh +1   The Beldama +1   The Tide Witches +1   The Merchants -1   The Bards -1   The Prostitutes -1   Wrothgarian Mountains and its associated factions +1 (Allies/Enemies affiliations for listed factions are not considered.) Enemies[edit] None

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to a Quester of your Knightly Order. Head to the specified dungeon. Find and kill the undead ancestor, a mummy. Report back to the Quester within the time limit.
Detailed Walkthrough: An Ancestor's Unexpected Return[edit] Speat to the Quester, who says: "Have I got a good one for you. It seems (noble's name) just read about an ancient family curse. Now (he/she) is scared out of (his/her) mind. (He/She) wants someone to go destroy (his/her) great, great, great grandmother, whom (he/she) fears walks the earth as an undead monstrosity. Are you interested, (player's guild title)?" or "This may potentially be nothing more than a simple poke around a tomb, but (noble's name) has asked us to investigate the resting place of (his/her) great, great, great grand mother. Apparently (he/she) had a dream that she had been brought to life and would escape from the family burial mound in (time limit) days. Perhaps it is all perfect rot, but perhaps not. Will you investigate, (player's guild title)? Accept[edit] The Quester goes on: (Noble's name)'s ancient ancestor is entombed in a mausoleum named (dungeon) that was designed to prevent graverobbing. There is no proof she is even undead. Odds are she's just a corpse. If so, burn the body in a proper funeral pyre. Get back within (time limit) days, or (noble's name) says the curse will be triggered." Decline[edit] The Quester answers: "If you run into any knights that might take this job, send them to me.' Laid To Rest (Again)[edit] Head to the dungeon named by the Quester and enter it. Seek out and destroy the undead creature within, which will be a mummy. Depending on the dungeon, there may be more than one mummy within, but only one will be the target creature. When it dies, you receive a notification: The mummy is laid to rest. (Noble's name) need not worry about that curse now. Once the mummy is again dead, return to the Order. Reward[edit] Upon reporting back to the Quester, he says: "Well I'll be. I didn't figure (noble's name)'s ancestor was really one of the walking dead! You have saved the local people much misery and suffering." Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] A successfully completed quest results in a reputation gain according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Generic Knightly Order +5   Knight Order +12   City-State where the order is located +14   Nobility of the city-state where the order is located +7   People of the city-state where the order is located +14   All other factions of the city-state where the order is located +7 A failed quest results in a reputation loss according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Generic Knightly Order -2   Knight Order -2  Enemies[edit] Random dungeon monsters Quest Target: One Mummy

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to a noble. Head to the dungeon the noble mentioned to you. Find your target within the dungeon and kill it. Return to the noble within the time limit for your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Wizard may choose to overwhelm you with powerful spells... ...or bring a few friends to the fight. Malevolent Magicka[edit] Speak to a noble, who says: "The whining peasants who work my land near (dungeon) have long complained about evil wizardry being practiced in that dungeon. It appears that this time they may be right. I am in need of an assassin with enough time to travel to (dungeon) and destroy the necromantic sorceror [sic] there. I am prepared to pay (random gold) gold pieces for this service. Are you interested?" Accept[edit] The noble goes on: "(Oath), that's grand. I need to have this wizard extinguished in (time limit) days, so you will probably want to get on the road right away. Good luck, (player's first name), and show no mercy." Decline[edit] The noble answers: "Really? I would have thought this was your sort of an assignment. How inconvenient." Slaying the Necromancer[edit] This quest is a standard dungeon crawl. The toughest thing will be to locate the wizard in the random dungeon. Your target will be a battlemage, a mage, an orc shaman or a sorcerer, each with a 25% chance of appearing. When you find and hit the target for the first time, the wizard will shout: "You must be the latest poor fool (noble's name) has hired to try to kill me. Your bones will soon join those of your compatriots, scattered about my dungeon!" The necromancer will likely toss some powerful spells at you, so it would be to your advantage to have protection against these. When the target dies, a message appears: (Wizard's name) the wizard is dead. Once you have killed the wizard, return to the noble and report success. Reward[edit] When you report back after you taking care of the wizard, the noble will thank you by saying: "The mighty hero returns! The farmers are overjoyed that their land is free of black magic, and I share their joy. Accept the (random gold) gold pieces, (player's first name), with my gratitude." Note: if you kill the evil wizard you will lose reputation with The Merchants, even if a logical connection between the wizard's death and a possible disadvantage for the Merchants is not obvious.
