Quick Walkthrough: Talk to a Merchant or an Innkeeper. Head to the specified dungeon. Find and kill a clan harpy within. Pick up the harpy's gryphon's feather. Exit the dungeon and receive a letter. (Optional) Re-enter the dungeon and find the mercenary. Head back to the town where you got the quest, either alone or with the mercenary. Give the gryphon's feather to your employer within the time limit and collect your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Take care of an infestation Winged Infestation[edit] Speak to a Merchant or Innkeeper, who says: "I have a not uncommon situation on my hands. A nest of harpies has moved into an old property of mine, and while I personally couldn't care less, our wise and benevolent (ruler's title) has decreed that the owner of any structure infested by harpies is responsible for extermination. There is apparently a fine involved for noncompliance. Frankly, I don't have the time for this; but if you wouldn't mind bloodying your sword a bit, I could use your help. The last mercenary I hired didn't make it, so I would understand if you're hesitant. I'd be happy to pay you, say, (random gold) gold pieces for your trouble." Accept[edit] The merchant/innkeeper goes on: Would you? Marvelous. Now, the catch is that I must have proof that a serious effort has been made to clear out (dungeon) in (time limit) days. Obviously that does not leave a lot of time. I had hoped that (mercenary's name), the mercenary I had hired earlier from the Fighters Guild would have been more capable. And, listen, (player's first name), you don't have to clear out all (dungeon). Just kill four or five of the critters and get back here. I know! The clan leaders wear specially dyed gryphon's feathers. Bring back one of those and I'll have the proof I need. Just make certain you don't fail to return in (time limit) days, (player's first name)." Decline[edit] The merchant/innkeeper answers: "(Oath). Well, I can't blame you. Never could abide the stench of harpies myself." Pluck the Feather[edit] The clan feather The mercenary is stuck in the dungeon Before setting out, keep in mind that your weapons need to be of dwarven or better make to harm harpies. Once you are ready, head to the infested dungeon and enter it. There may be many of harpies in the dungeon, but only one of them will have a clan feather on its body. After you have found and killed the wanted harpy, pick up the clan feather (which appears as just an ordinary gryphon's feather) from its body and a message pops up: You have found a clan feather. You only need this feather to complete the quest successfully. Return it to your employer for your reward. (Optional) Rescue Mission[edit] Sometime between seventeen hours to about two days after starting the quest, you will be approached: A young courier appears at your side, hands you a letter, and disappears without a word. The letter is from your employer, and reads: (Employer's building), (town) Dear (player's name), I am sorry to annoy you while I'm sure you're busy, but I received a caller from the Fighters Guild on the subject of (mercenary's name), that mercenary I first hired to clean out (dungeon). Without boring you with the details of the interview, let me tell you that I promised the Guildmaster I'd ask you to look for (mercenary's name) while you're in (dungeon). (Mercenary's name) looks is [sic] a (mercenary's description), so (he/she) should stick out at (dungeon). Well, I've fulfilled my promise to the Guildmaster. Personally, I don't care if you throw this letter away and let (mercenary's name) rot in (dungeon). I am eagerly awaiting your return. Yours truly, (Employer's name) If you choose to mount a rescue, you will find the mercenary at the same location where you previously killed the clan harpy. This should make the task much easier, assuming you remember where this was. Another clan harpy will spawn there as well. When found, the mercenary will say: "You're from (employer's name)? Thank (god's name) you arrived, (player's first name). Hope you don't mind if I join you. Take this (jewelry) as a sign of my gratitude." The mercenary will now be following you. Exit the dungeon and head back to your employer. As soon as you arrive in town the mercenary will take their leave, saying: "Thank you, (player's first name). I know my way home from here." Give the gryphon's feather to your employer and collect your reward. You will gain a considerable amount of reputation with the Fighters Guild if you rescue the mercenary; who will also give you a piece of jewelry for your trouble. This makes the whole task of reentering the dungeon once again worth the trouble. However, if you take your time getting to the dungeon and wait around a bit before entering, you may receive the letter before you have even had a chance to enter. If so, you can kill the harpy, get the feather, and rescue the mercenary all in one go; however you must still find them within. If you don't wish to bother rescuing the mercenary, just travel back to your employer. Reward[edit] Upon receiving the feather your employer says: "Well done, (player's first name). Now I can prove to the (ruler's title) that I've done my civic duty, or at least attempted to do it. You have earned your (random gold) gold indeed. Thank you." Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] A successfully completed quest results in a reputation gain according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Questgiver's faction +5   Questgiver's associated factions +2 A failed quest (time limit expired) results in a reputation loss according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Questgiver's faction -2   Questgiver's associated factions -1 Additional Reputation[edit] If you also rescue the mercenary, you will gain reputation according to the table below: Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Fighters Guild +10   Fighters Guild's associated factions +5 Enemies[edit] Random dungeon monsters Quest Target: One Clan-Harpy 15x One Harpy every twenty-one in-game minutes (25% chance) once you enter the dungeon

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to the quest giver of your Temple. Head to the town the quest giver points you to. Enter the haunted house and kill the undead creature inside. Return to the quest giver within the time limit and collect your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: A zombie haunting the dining area A skeletal warrior roaming the halls A ghost in the attic  Old Haunts[edit] Speak to a quest giver, who says: "A house over in (town) is being haunted by some sort of undead. We need someone to exorcise the spirit. Are you up to it? It pays (random gold) gold pieces." Accept[edit] The quest giver goes on: "Remember, if the haunt is too tough for you to handle yourself, just get out of there. No one will blame you for saving your skin. The place is called (residence) and it's in (town). You have (time limit) days or we send someone else out to do the job." Decline[edit] The quest giver answers: "No shame in that. I'll keep an eye open for jobs more to your liking." Exorcise the Undead[edit] Head to town and ask around until you have the location of the house. Sometimes the building is locked, so you either need to pick the lock or have an Open spell available. Once you are inside look for the undead, which can be a ghost, skeletal warrior, wraith, or zombie; each has a 25% chance of appearing. The undead can often be found in the attic; where else should an undead be? Sometimes the door to the attic is locked too, therefore you may need some assistance for this door as well. Upon hitting the undead for the first time it moans: "I am the ancestor of the builder of this house. It now belongs to the dead. Let all living creatures shun this place." Kill it and head back to your quest giver. Reward[edit] When you come for your reward the quest giver says: "So the haunt is no more. I will burn incense at the altar for its spirit. Here is your temple fee." Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] A successfully completed quest results in a reputation gain according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Deity of the Temple +5   Temple and its associated factions +2 A failed quest results in a reputation loss according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Deity of the Temple -2   Temple and its associated factions -1 Enemies[edit] One of the following (25% chance of each): Ghost Skeletal Warrior Wraith Zombie

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to a quest giver of a Temple. Head to the town the quest giver points you to. Find the cousin and talk to him/her. Ask around until you learn about a healer living in another town. Find the healer there and buy a cure. Return to the cousin and give him/her the cure within the time limit.
Detailed Walkthrough: An Ounce of Prevention[edit] Speak to the quest giver, who says: "The best way to get in good with the temple is to heal someone. I know of a case that might do the trick for you (player's name). Are you willing?" or "I am (quest giver's name). You aren't high in the hierarchy of (temple). I might be able to speak favorably of you if you were to find a way to cure someone I know." Accept[edit] The quest giver goes on: "(Cousin's name) in (town) is suffering from an unusual disease. I was about to dispatch a cleric to treat (him/her). I will delay them a day or so. If you can find a cure it would increase your favor with (temple). I can only give you (time limit) days." Decline[edit] The quest giver answers: "If you aren't even willing or able to do a simple healing, I surely can't recommend you to temple leaders." A Pound of Cure[edit] The Alchemist has the cure  Travel to the mentioned town. Ask around until someone points you to the cousin's location, which may be a house or a shop. Enter the building and talk to the cousin, who says: "I feel so weak. I don't know what is wrong with me. Have you come to help me? Yes? Do you have the cure? If so, please use it on me, so that I may heal." With no other clues to go on, ask the locals about the cousin. Eventually, someone will tell you a rumor that a healer in another town might have a cure for the disease. When you speak to the cousin, there is a 50% chance that you will also become infected by the disease. If this happens, you may wish to get yourself cured before you go on with the quest. A visit to a local temple, a spell, or a potion can be used to cure the disease. Travel to the town where the healer, an alchemist, lives. Ask around until you know where to find their location, then speak with them. The healer says: "Hello there. Yes, I have heard of (cousin's name) of (town) and (his/her) problem. Lunar Chills it is. Often mistaken for Gray Fever. Anyway, I do have a some Hoar Frost Root that will cure it. It can only be used once though. I'll sell it to you for 20 gold." Reward[edit] Return to the cousin's residence with the cure and be told: "Thank you, (player's name). I will use the Hoar Frost Root. I really can't thank you enough. I hope the rest of your travels are safe for you." Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] A successfully completed quest results in a reputation gain according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Deity of the Temple +5   Temple and its associated factions +2 A failed quest results in a reputation loss according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Deity of the Temple -2   Temple and its associated factions -1 Enemies[edit] None

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to a Noble. Head to the town the alchemist is located. Prepare to fight or flee from attacking daedroths. Give the Daedra's heart to the alchemist. Return to the noble within the time limit and collect your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Organ Donation[edit] Noble says: "I have an acquaintance, an alchemist of some skill by the name of (alchemist's name). In order to complete a project of mine, (he/she) needs a rather rare item -- the heart of a daedra. I won't lie to you; the daedra want this heart back, and you may encounter some of them along the way. Are you willing to risk this, in reward for a generous fee?" Accept[edit] Noble goes on: "You will? Then good luck to you. Here is the daedra's heart. If it is not in my friend (alchemist's name)'s hands in (time limit) days, it will be too old to be used. After you have delivered it, return for your reward. Good luck and godspeed." Decline[edit] Noble answers: "I'm disappointed, but I can't say I don't understand. Volunteering for an assignment involving the daedra certainly requires more bravery and valor than is commonly seen in (player's race) adventurers." Deliver the Heart[edit] The daedroth is furious - though not without reason This quest is more interesting than the usual deliveries one can make for a noble. You must deliver a Daedra's heart to an alchemist in time, but the problem is its brethren want it back. A Daedroth will pursue you on your journey to the town where the alchemist lives until you have either delivered the heart or given up. When you encounter the Daedroth, it will immediately attack: The daedra hisses, "(player's name), you meddle in affairs beyond your ken. Yes, your name is now known to us. And we will not rest until the heart of our brother is back in our hands. Prepare to fulfill your destiny, mortal..." If you choose to not deliver the heart, you will lose an enormous amount of reputation with the noble you got the quest from and their associated factions. If you deliver the heart to the alchemist in time, you will suffer a great deal of reputation loss with not only a random Daedra Prince, but also Oblivion and any associated Daedra Princes. Since it is very difficult to restore reputation with Oblivion or a Daedra Prince by means other than waiting for the reputation to increment back to zero, this decision is a more serious one than losing reputation with the noble. Be that as it may, the choice is yours to make. And do not forget, you need a mithril weapon or better to harm a Daedroth. To complete the quest, locate and enter the shop you were sent to. When you deliver the heart, the alchemist says: "Oh marvelous. An outstanding aortas daedrae, with minimal decomposition. Hurry back to (quest giver's name) now, (player's first name). There's a lot on (his/her) mind, and if you're not back in (second time limit) days, (he/she) may forget you even left."  Reward[edit] The time limit given by the alchemist may be very tight, so be prepared to travel speedily. When you return after completing delivery of the Daedra's heart, the noble will say: "Outstanding job, (player's first name). I knew those daedralings wouldn't slow you down. Your superior skill has been duly noted. Thank you and here is the (random gold) gold we agreed on." Quick Walkthrough: Talk to a Noble. Head to the dungeon the noble points you to. Find and retrieve the heirloom. Head back to the noble Return the item within the time limit for your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Sentimental Value[edit] Speak to a noble, who says: "I have a (item) that's very precious to me. It's been handed down from generation to generation in my family. Knowing this, a small pack of orcish bandits have stolen it and are holding it for ransom. I have no intention of rewarding them for this outrage. On the other hand, I will pay the full amount of the ransom, (random gold) gold pieces to you if you would go to their holdout and steal the (item) back. Will you?" Accept[edit] The noble goes on: "Good. Now, I am given to understand that the orcs' hideout in in [sic] the old (dungeon). That's where, I suppose, they're keeping my (item) as well. If you're not back in (time limit) days, I'll presume you haven't found the (item), and will give your reward money to the orcs as ransom. Don't fail me on this, (player's first name). Good luck." Decline[edit] The noble answers: "(Oath)! You will not do this for me? Then I will have to pay the ransom. You disappoint me, (player's first name)." Recover the Heirloom[edit] The orcs have some interesting hiding spots for their loot  Just a standard dungeon crawl. Head to the dungeon and find the heirloom, which will be a random piece of jewelry. When you pick up the item, you will get a notification: You have found the (item). Bring it back to the noble for your reward. Reward[edit] When you bring back the item, the noble will thank you and say: "Somehow I knew you'd find my (item), (player's first name). I will happily give you the gold I was saving for the (item)'s ransom. I cannot thank you enough." Quick Walkthrough: Talk to a quest giver of your Temple. Meet the cleric in the town and tavern mentioned to you. (Optional) Alternatively, find the priest(ess) in the dungeon mentioned to you. Learn about the prophet's lover and travel to their location. Meet and speak to the lover. Receive a letter or a denial from the lover. If you did not receive the lover's letter, wait for a courier to deliver a message (or two). Investigate one or both messages, and receive the lover's letter or a severed finger. Report back to the quest giver with either the lover's letter or the finger within the time limit and collect your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: The cleric... ...the priestess... ...the prophet... ...and her lover  A Possible Prophet[edit] Speak to a quest giver, who says: "(Temple god) be with you, (player's guild title). You may have heard of (prophet's name). If you have not yet, you will. We are investigating (his/her) claims that (he/she) is a prophet. We are not, I think, censorious by nature, but we must ever be alert to the presence of heretical influences. Would you be available to assist in this important investigation?" or "It falls upon us to investigate the claims of (prophet's name) that (he/she) has seen the face and heard the words of (Temple god). Perhaps you have time to assist in this inquiry?" Accept[edit] The quest giver goes on: Good. We have already sent one of the Temple, (priest(ess)' name) to the desacrilized (dungeon), where (prophet's name) asserts that (he/she) first witnessed the miracle. If (priest(ess)' name) needs assistance, I will send for you. In the meanwhile, I want you to find some more secular information on (prophet's name), by asking around in (his/her) hometown, (town). A loyal cleric of ours, (cleric's name) will meet you in (tavern). I want to see evidence of the true nature of (prophet's name) in no more than (time limit) days. I would leave immediately. May Great (Temple's deity) bless your enterprise, (player's guild rank). Decline[edit] The quest giver answers: "That's a pity, (player's guild title). I hope you will find time in your busy schedule for the temple in the near future." The Investigation[edit] There are two ways to proceed with this part of the quest; either one will lead you to the next step of your investigation. You may do both if you wish. Option I: Meet the Cleric[edit] If you wish to follow the quest giver's instructions, then travel to the prophet's hometown and meet the cleric in the specified tavern. The cleric has much to say: "Ah hello, (player's first name). Welcome to (town). The whole town's in a buzz about that young (prophet's name). But (he/she) isn't even here -- (he/she)'s in (prophet's town) at a tavern called (prophet's tavern), working on a new tract about what this mysterious spirit of (dungeon) had to say about the moral disintegration of (temple). Here's a copy of the original tractate, so you know what this (prophet's name)'s all about. Dangerous character from what I've seen so far. I'm communicating with (lover's name), a (lover's description) in (lover's town) with whom (prophet's name) had some kind of relationship. It wouldn't be a bad idea for you to go to (lover's town) and see if you can't persuade (him/her) to talk to us. Hope all this is helpful information, (player's first name)." Check your inventory for the religious tractate the cleric gave you, which reads: I scarcely remember my voyage to the place called (dungeon): I expect I was still partly dreaming. Deep within the stinking recesses of the profaned temple, I was met with a great fire and from the flames I heard the same voice speak: "Welcome."      "Who art thou?" I addressed the flame.      "I am what (temple) doth proclaim to worship, but with every act and thought defile my divinity. To thee I called so that a new (temple) might be created, one led by truth and true insight, and understanding of my Being. The heathen need insight, and you shall be it."      The God told me more that day, but while the wicked (temple) continues their policy of quashing any who dare to challenge their corrupted, contemptible theology, I must keep my tracts short. More will follow shortly hereafter. Option II: Find the Priest(ess)[edit] If, on the other hand, you feel like doing some dungeon crawling, you can seek out the priest(ess) instead of the cleric. Proceed straight to the dungeon where the prophet claims to have received these visions and find the priest(ess) within, who will say: "(Player's first name), I thought that you were supposed to be investigating the situation in (town). Well, as long as you're here, I have something different for you to do. I've found some torn up letters, scraps really, about a (lover's description) somewhere in (lover's town) by the name of (lover's name). See if you can't find something on (him/her). I don't know if (he/she)'ll talk, but it's worth a try." You now have enough information to find the lover, and if you spoke to the cleric, the prophet as well. However, if you seek out the prophet at this time, all you will be told is: "How they come to persecute me. Abandon your unholy abuse, hound of (temple). I am under protection of my god ... and the (ruler's title) of (region)." Since this is a dead end, seek out the lover for more information. Locate the Lover[edit] The prophet's bodyguard will step in if confronted Travel to the town the cleric or priest(ess) named, ask around to find the lover, and meet with them. The lover will belong to a random faction. In most cases this will be a subgroup of one of the eight Temples, a subgroup of the Mages Guild or one of the Knightly Orders. However, there is no way to tell which one it will end up being. If your reputation with this faction is at least five, the lover will say: "(Prophet's name) would kill me if (he/she) knew I was talking to you. But I know that you couldn't be working for (him/her). Here's a letter (he/she) wrote to me about a month ago. I think it explains everything." Check your inventory for the letter. It reads: (Lover's name), My Love, First, forgive the silence of your love. It was not another attack of brain fever. For some months now, I have been in spiritual turmoil, unfit to for any company, even for the comfort of your dulcet fellowship. My days of pain are over, but for this -- I can never see you again. My life has a higher purpose than the fulfillment of a ridiculous love affair now. No longer can I suffer the evil of (temple), the evil they did to me, and the evil they are doing to all of Tamriel. The days the prophet Marukh spoke of are on us again. I must rally the people by any and all lies, innuendo, bigotry, and threats to rise against the spiritual tyranny of (temple). Forgive me, my former love. And if you can, forget me. And if you can do neither, do not see me. If you do, I will slay you and stick candles in your eyes and twine your organs with beads for the greater glory of the gods of the universe. Filthy (lover's description), torment me no longer. (Prophet's name) The letter reveals that the prophet is obviously an impostor, which should be the evidence the Temple needs. Return with this letter to the quest giver for your reward. Alternatively, you can show the letter to the prophet, who will be furious and yell: "(Lover's name)! False creature, deceiver! How (he/she) will pay! (Warrior's name), deal with this (player's race)!" The prophet takes the letter from you and flees, and a warrior will show up to kill you. If your reputation with the lover's faction is lower than five, the lover will deny knowing the prophet: "Whatever they say, I never knew that (prophet's name). Tell (cleric's name) (he/she) has the wrong (lover's description)." You will not get the lover's letter in this event; in this case, or if the prophet took the letter from you, you must wait until the quest moves on. The Aftermath[edit] The cleric's replacement A severed finger  Two to about twenty-one days after the quest was started you will be approached: A young lad hands you a letter and scurries off. You may receive one of two letters, or both. Either letter will lead to enough evidence to satisfy the quest giver. The First Letter[edit] The first letter is addressed from the cleric's tavern. It seems something unfortunate has happened there: (Tavern) (Tavern's town) Dear (player's name), There's been a horrible accident here at (tavern), involving (cleric's name). Please come here  when you can. Yours sincerely, (Replacement's name) Meet the sender, a replacement cleric sent by the Temple, who will be at the same tavern the first cleric was staying at earlier. Speak to this successor, who will tell you the first cleric was murdered: "(Oath), (player's first name), it was dreadful. The tavernkeep found (cleric's name) in one of the rooms, (his/her) body defiled in the most horrifying way, a grim parody of the old (temple) mortuary rites. It was (prophet's name), no doubt. This relic was found in (cleric's name)'s chest cavity. See if (lover's name) in (lover's town) recognizes it." The replacement will give you the religious artifact which was used in the cleric's murder. If you show the artifact to the prophet's lover, it provokes shock and horror: (Religious artifact)! (Oath), that's poor (prophet's name)'s property. (Oath), I knew (he/she) was unstable, but I never thought (he/she)'d really do it. (Oath), poor (cleric's name). If I had helped (him/her), (he/she)'d still be alive today. This won't make up for what I've done by failing to act, but you will know what to do with this letter. May (random god) forgive me. The lover will now give you the letter which reveals the prophet as an impostor. Return this letter to the quest giver for your reward. If confronted with the religious artifact, the prophet will snatch it from you and say: "Thank (random god), I was afraid I had lost that. Thank you, good (player's race)." If the prophet takes the artifact, it will make it impossible to get the letter from the lover. Thus, you will be unable to gather the evidence to complete the quest by following this trail. The only other means of completing the quest comes if you have also received the second letter. The Second Letter[edit] The second letter you may receive reads as follows: (Temple) (Temple's town) (Player's guild rank) (player's name), (Priest(ess)' name) has failed to meet with the man to whom (he/she) was to report (his/her) findings in (dungeon). We must assume the worst. You are hereby ordered to find either (priest(ess)' name) (him/her)-self or (his/her) body in (dungeon) and report back to me. All other assignments and investigations take lower priority. (Quest giver's name) Travel to the dungeon to look for clues. Seek out the priest(ess)' earlier location, and make a grisly discovery - a severed finger: You pick up a scrap of flesh, carefully, even ritually ritualistically stripped from a (priest(ess)' description)'s hand. This was once a finger of (priest(ess)' name). Return the finger to the Temple; the quest giver will accept it as evidence and reward you. If you show the finger to the prophet, it will be taken from you amidst some amusing comments. If you are not able to procure the lover's letter after losing the finger, you will be unable to complete the quest. Reward[edit] To complete the quest successfully, you must return to the Temple with either the prophet's lover's letter or the severed finger. Hand over either and the quest giver will say: "Well done, (player's guild title). I tremble to think what (prophet's name) might have done to our temple had (he/she) spread (his/her) profane word. (Temple god) bless you and keep you, goodly (player's race). Here, a small token of the esteem of your brethren." Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] A successfully completed quest results in a reputation gain according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Deity of the Temple +5   Temple and its associated factions +2 A failed quest results in a reputation loss according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Deity of the Temple -2   Temple and its associated factions -1 Enemies[edit] Random dungeon monsters One Warrior if you show the lover's letter to the prophet

Quick Walkthrough: Summon Hermaeus Mora on the 5th of First Seed. Head to the town named by Hermaeus Mora. Enter to the palace and kill the noble. Travel to the second town Hermaeus Mora named. Meet his worshipper there within the time limit and receive the Oghma Infinium.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Price of Knowledge[edit] The Daedra Prince wants this spellsword dead The noble will send barbarians after you if you decline to help... ...and you will also be pursued by archers if the noble dies Hermaeus Mora's worshipper is fittingly found in a library Hermaeus Mora's Worshipper The Oghma Infinium Upon a successful summoning, Hermaeus Mora appears and speaks to you: "Power, yes, is an allusive but eloquent prosecution. One of my minions possesses an ancient tome called the Oghma Infinum, which bequeaths great power on those who read its pages. If you exterminate a certain scrofulous patrician who has aroused my displeasure, I will arrange a meeting between you and the book. Is this agreeable?" Accept[edit] Hermaeus Mora goes on: "Very well. This socialite I referred to resides at the palace of (town). For the record, the name of your quarry is (noble's name). Kill (him/her) and proceed to (contact's town), where my servant (contact's name) will wait for you in a library. I do not think there is anything to be gained by continuing this interview. Fail me not in this, (player's first name), and the power thou craves will be thine." Decline[edit] Hermaeus Mora responds with disappointment: "You answer negatively. Am I to understand that you sought power, but seek it for free? You ought to have sought wisdom instead, for that is what you need. I bid you a very disappointed goodbye." Cornering the Noble[edit] Travel to the city named by the Daedra Prince and enter the palace. Find and attack the noble, who appears as a spellsword. When hit for the first time, your opponent says: "No! Wait! I swear, I meant to pay Lord Mora back. Don't kill me, I beg of you! Here, spare my life and take this (magic item) back to him as a token of my goodwill and a down payment on what I owe. Please, will you?" You have three options: Decline the offer and kill the noble. Accept the offer and don't kill the noble. Accept the offer, but kill the noble anyway. If you kill the noble, a message appears: Hermaeus Mora will be pleased-- you have slain (noble's name). In this case, simply report to the contact for your reward. However, if you accepted the offer, you will receive a magic item to deliver to the contact. Bring the magic item to Mora's worshipper, who will take it but give you no reward in return. Alternatively, you can accept the magical item but kill the noble anyway. Travel to Hermaeus Mora's worshipper, who will take the item from you and give you your reward as promised. Reward[edit] Regardless of your choice, head to your contact's town. Ask around and eventually you will be given their location, a local library. Enter the library and speak to Mora's worshipper to complete the quest. If you accepted the noble's magic item, the worshipper will begin by saying: "Hmm, well, thanks for the (magic item), I guess... Now, let's get down to business." If you spared the noble's life, the quest ends with no reward, only these words: "You're telling me you let that little worm live, and you bring me this pathetic (magic item) instead of (noble's name)'s blood on your hands? Hermaeus Mora will be very unhappy with this news." If you killed the noble, your contact will be pleased and say: "(Player's first name), I underestimated you. I told Mora you couldn't do it, but here you are, and all (region) is in an uproar over (noble's name) death. As promised, the book. Remember: you can only read it once. See you later, maybe." The Oghma Infinium will be found in your inventory. Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] If you successfully complete the Daedra Prince's task and receive the artifact, you will gain reputation according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Summoner's faction +5   Summoner's associated factions +2 If you fail the quest, you will lose reputation according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Summoner's faction -2   Summoner's associated factions -1 Enemies[edit] Quest Target: One Spellsword NPC 5x One Barbarian every two in-game minutes (35% chance) if you decline the noble's offer 5x One Ranger every three in-game minutes (50% chance) once the noble is dead

Quick Walkthrough: Summon Hircine any time at the Glenmoril Coven or its followers. Head to the dungeon named by Hircine. Find and kill the wereboar. Travel to the town where Hircine's follower awaits. Meet his worshiper there within the time limit and receive The Hircine Ring.
Detailed Walkthrough: Indoor covens are happy to summon Hircine any day of the year Two thieves guarding the wereboar in its bone-strewn lair Hircine's devoted follower waits with your reward The Hircine Ring  A Wild Hunt[edit] Hircine appears and starts speaking to the player: "If you would not mind doing a small favor for me, I can put in your possession a most excellent reward, The Hircine Ring. I have a child, apparently miserable with all the blessings I have given him, who needs ... what is the euphemism? To be taught a lesson? A very serious lesson. Does this sound like an agreeable contract, (player's guild rank/player's name)?" Accept[edit] Hircine goes on: "Ah, good. This child of mine is a wereboar who has made his den in a place called (dungeon). You should have no trouble finding it. After you have put him out of his obvious misery, which should not take more than (time limit) days, go to a place called (building) in (town) and look for a person named (worshiper's name). If you arrive there within (time limit) days from now with the wereboar dead, (he/she) will give you The Hircine Ring. A pleasure doing business with you, (player's guild rank/player's name). Good luck and farewell." Decline[edit] Hircine answers, disappointed: "I am gravely disappointed, (player's guild rank/player's name)." or "Seldom am I summoned, even rarer are the occasions when I am free to answer a summonings [sic]. To be perfectly blunt, this was a waste of my very precious time." Tracking the Wereboar[edit] Travel to the dungeon Hircine named and enter it. Once inside, find and kill the wereboar. There may be more than one wereboar inside the dungeon, but once you have slain the target creature a message appears: The wereboar is dead, as you promised Daedra Prince Hircine. Once the creature is dead, meet Hircine's worshiper in the town and building the Daedra Prince named and you will receive your reward. Reward[edit] Speak to Hircine's worshipper to report your success and you will hear: "Hello, (player's first name). You made it. Hircine's impressed with you, which is no small accomplishment. Here's The Hircine Ring you were promised. Take care." Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] If you successfully complete the Daedra Prince's task and receive the artifact, you will gain reputation according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Summoner's faction +5   Summoner's associated factions +2 If you fail the quest, you will lose reputation according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Summoner's faction -2   Summoner's associated factions -1 Enemies[edit] Random dungeon monsters Quest Target: One Wereboar

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to the quest giver at a Thieves Guild hall. Go to the town where the guild member is stuck. Meet the thief in a tavern there. Take the stolen gem and give your contact the metal. Return to the quest giver with the stolen gem within the time limit for your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Family Business[edit] Speak to a quest giver, who says: "Listen, (player's first name), we got one of our family who's in trouble. You got a couple days to help out one of the family?" Accept[edit] The quest giver goes on: "Good (player's race). One of our best catburglars in (town) is holed up in a rat-trap called (tavern). On (his/her) person is a hot stone (he/she) lifted from the palace. Now the word is that someone saw it on (him/her), and the guards are casing the place. Out of respect for the owner of (tavern), they're waiting (time limit) days before moving in. Get over to (tavern) and give (contact's name) this hunk of (metal) in exchange for the (gem), and then you bring it back here. You understand? Good. Now, hurry, there ain't time." Decline[edit] The quest giver answers: "Alright then. Guess you're countin' on not bein' in a fix yourself some day." Switching the Stone[edit] The unlucky thief is trapped with the stolen goods The guards may be onto your scheme  Travel to the town where the guild member is holed up. Find the tavern, enter it, and meet with your guild associate, who greets you by saying: "(Oath), (player's first name), you're a life saver. Turns out someone saw me with a (gem) and they figure it's the stolen gem. This hunk of (metal) will be my ticket out of here. Remind me to buy you a drink sometime. Now hurry back to (quest giver's name). They're gonna be real suspicious if you're not back in (time limit) days." Exchange the stolen gem with the metal and return to the Guildhall. On your way back you may encounter some guards trying to get the gem from you. When you hit one for the first time, you will hear: "I have it on good authority that you have the (gem) that (contact's name) stole. Hand it over and I'll let you go unharmed." If you give it to them, naturally you will blow the quest and you will lose a lot of reputation with the Guild. Reward[edit] When you return with the gem, the quest giver will be pleased and say: "Good job, (player's first name). I hear that (contact's name) showed the guards the piece of (metal) they thought was a (gem), and they bought (him/her) a drink as an apology. I tell you, ain't no life like the life of a scoundrel. Here's your share of the (gem) -- (random gold) gold. You earned it, (player's first name)." Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] A successfully completed quest results in a reputation gain according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Thieves Guild +5   Shadow Schemers +5   Associated factions +2 A failed quest results in a reputation loss according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Thieves Guild -2   Shadow Schemers -2   Associated factions -1 (Allies/Enemies affiliations for listed factions are not considered in the tables.) Additional Reputation[edit] If you don't bring the gem back to the quest giver in time, you will lose reputation according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Thieves Guild -22   Shadow Schemers -12   Associated factions -11 (Allies/Enemies affiliations for listed factions are not considered in the tables) If you give the gem to the guard, you will lose reputation according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Thieves Guild -42   Shadow Schemers -22   Associated factions -21 (Allies/Enemies affiliations for listed factions are not considered in the tables) Enemies[edit] 3x One Knight every one hundred seventy-three in-game minutes (5% chance) after picking up the gem

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to the Fighter Quester of a Fighters Guild. Head to the dungeon the Fighter Quester mentions to you. Find the Daedroth within the dungeon and kill it. Return to the Fighter Quester within the time limit for your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: From Oblivion[edit] Daedroths are powerful foes The Fighter Quester says: "Something's come up. I don't know who else could handle it but you, (player's first name). There's this bad critter in (dungeon), a Daedroth. Now, I ain't lying -- no one knows why it's there, but everyone wants it gone. For (random gold) gold, you think you could handle it, (player's first name)?" Accept[edit] The Fighter Quester goes on: "Hey, alright, your funeral, (player's first name). Listen, knock off that Daedroth and get back here in (time limit) days for your reward. I don't know how long that thing's gonna be around, so you're gonna want to move your ass. And listen to me on this, (player's first name) -- go prepared for a hell of a fight." Decline[edit] The Fighter Quester answers: "I don't blame you, (player's first name). I wouldn't wanna take on a Daedroth either." Mean Green Monster[edit] Prepare yourself before embarking on this quest, do not forget that you need mithril weapons or better to harm a daedroth. Travel to the dungeon the Fighter Quester mentioned and slay the creature. There may be more than one daedroth depending on your level and the dungeon. When the correct daedroth is slain, you will receive the following message: The Daedroth is dead. Reward[edit] Return to the Fighter Quester after killing the Daedroth, and he will say: "Hey, you're a better (player's race) than me, (player's first name). Daedroth-killer. I like it. Here's your gold." There is a 50% chance he will also give you a random dungeon map, adding: "Since you didn't even blink at offing a Daedroth, take this map to (random dungeon). Plenty of fun for a (player's guild rank) like you." Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] A successfully completed quest results in a reputation gain according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Fighters Guild +5   Fighter Questers +5   Associated factions +2 A failed quest results in a reputation loss according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Fighters Guild -2   Fighter Questers -2   Associated factions -1 (Allies/Enemies affiliations for listed factions are not considered in the tables.)

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to the Fighter Quester of a Fighters Guild. Head to the dungeon the Fighter Quester mentions. Find the gargoyle within and kill it. Return to the Fighter Quester within the time limit and collect your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Cheating a mage is never a good idea. A Mage's Revenge[edit] Speak to the Fighter Quester, who says: "A certain merchant needs to have a monster, a gargoyle to be precise, dispatched. The pay is a modest (random gold) gold pieces. Can I have your help in this matter?" Accept[edit] The Fighter Quester goes on: "It seems this merchant hired a wizard to build him a grand mansion. Then the poor fool tried to cheat the mage of his wages. The wizard grew angry and animated one of the stone gargoyles on the new mansion. It has been attacking the merchant ceaselessly. Go out to (dungeon) and kill the thing. You've got (time limit) days to complete the task." Decline[edit] The Fighter Quester answers: "Hmmm. Not the brave, heroic sort I guess." Blood from Stone[edit] This quest is a standard dungeon crawl. Travel to the dungeon the Fighter Quester mentioned, find the gargoyle within, and kill it. You will need mithril weapons or better to damage it. When the gargoyle has been killed, the following message will appear: The gargoyle is dead. Hopefully that foolish merchant has learned never to cheat a mage. Reward[edit] Return to the Fighter Quester after killing the gargoyle and he will say: "Hail to the hero, (player's name)! Well done! This paltry fee of (random gold) is hardly a worthy reward for such a deed." There is a 50% chance the Fighter Quester will also give you a dungeon map, adding: "Maybe this map to (random dungeon) will sweeten the deal a little." Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] A successfully completed quest results in a reputation gain according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Fighters Guild +5   Fighter Questers +5   Associated factions +2 A failed quest results in a reputation loss according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Fighters Guild -2   Fighter Questers -2   Associated factions -1 (Allies/Enemies affiliations for listed factions are not considered in the tables.) Enemies[edit] Random dungeon monsters Quest Target: One Gargoyle

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to a Fighter Quester in a Fighters Guild guildhall. Locate a building in the current town and kill the giant scorpion within. Report back to the Fighter Quester within the time limit.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Stinger[edit] The Fighter Quester says: "You can call me (Fighter Quester's name). Normally we only give jobs to guild members. But you show promise (player's name). I tell ya what. I got a request to dispose of a giant scorpion. Do that and I'll see if the guild will overlook your reputation. Is that a deal?" Accept[edit] The Fighter Quester goes on: "You got guts (player's first name), I'll give ya that. Apparently this scorpion escaped from someone's personal collection. Right now it's corner [sic] in (building). Kill the thing today and I'll speak well of you." Decline[edit] The Fighter Quester answers: "I try to be nice and look what it gets me. Just get outta here." Hunting the Scorpion[edit] This is a very simple task; go to the named building in the current town and kill the scorpion within. Be careful, as scorpion attacks can cause paralysis or disease. The target building can be any type. Shops, temples, and the like are not difficult to locate using the map, but you may have to ask around if the location is a residence. When you kill the giant scorpion, the following message pops up: The giant scorpion is dead. Reward[edit] Return to the Fighter Quester after killing the scorpion, and he says: "I guess you aren't the weak kneed jellyfish everyone says you are. I'll make sure the right people hear about this." Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] A successfully completed quest results in a reputation gain according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Fighters Guild +5   Fighter Questers +5   Associated factions +2 A failed quest results in a reputation loss according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Fighters Guild -2   Fighter Questers -2   Associated factions -1 (Allies/Enemies affiliations for listed factions are not considered in the tables.) Enemies[edit] One Giant Scorpion

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to the Fighter Quester of a Fighters Guild. Find the correct building in the current city and kill the spider. Report back to the Fighter Quester within the time limit.
Detailed Walkthrough: Arachnid Occupation[edit] The Fighter Quester says: "My name is (Fighter Quester's name). I don't like handing out jobs to non-guild members. You seem like the trustworthy sort though. Some poor soul brought home a giant spider's egg that hatched. Seems they mistook it for a silkworm cocoon. The poor slob can't afford to pay us to get rid of it. However, if you take care of it for free the guild looks good and I'll make sure you look good. Are you interested?" Accept[edit] The Fighter Quester goes on: "This is your shot at the big time. The spider is trapped in (building). Kill it today and I'll put in a good word for you." Decline[edit] The Fighter Quester answers: "I should have known you were serious about work." Slaying the Spider[edit] This book dealer almost became lunch  This is a once again a very easy task, the spider is holed up in a building in town. Enter the building and kill the spider, but beware of its paralyzing bite. When the monster has been vanquished, the following message pops up: The spider is dead. This task must be done within a day, so return to the Fighter Quester promptly afterwards. Reward[edit] Upon returning after killing the spider, the Fighter Quester will say: "You got spunk (player's first name). Keep up the good work and you'll be Fighter's Guild material yet." Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] A successfully completed quest results in a reputation gain according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Fighters Guild +5   Fighter Questers +5   Associated factions +2 A failed quest results in a reputation loss according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Fighters Guild -2   Fighter Questers -2   Associated factions -1 (Allies/Enemies affiliations for listed factions are not considered in the tables.) Enemies[edit] One Giant Spider

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to the Fighter Quester of a Fighters Guild. Head to the dungeon the Fighter Quester mentions. Find and kill your target within. Report back to the Fighter Quester within the time limit and collect your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: The lycanthrope may also be a wereboar... ...or just a regular grizzly bear  The Werebeast[edit] Speak to the Fighter Quester, who says: "We've got a little job you might be interested in. Seems there's a loup -- whatcha call your basic werewolf, wereboar, or some kind 'o werebeasty that's been bothering a lot of farmers in the area, and we need someone to kill it. It'll mean (random gold) gold in your pocket. That sound interesting to you?" Accept[edit] The Fighter Quester goes on: "Great. You'll find the loup over in (dungeon). We need the poor brute dead in (time limit) days, so you better be on your way, kid." Decline[edit] The Fighter Quester answers: "Fine. Guess someone else'll have to do it." Thrown for a Loup[edit] This quest is one of the many dungeon crawls in the game. Head to the dungeon the Fighter Quester mentioned to you and find your target within. It can be a wereboar, a werewolf, or just an ordinary grizzly bear; each creature has a 1 in 3 chance of appearing as the quest target. There may be many creatures of the same type among the random dungeon monsters, but the quest requires you to slay a specific one. When you kill the correct lycanthrope, you receive a message: The lycanthrope threat is ended. However, if the quest target is a grizzly bear, the following message pops up: This must be the "werebeast" everyone is afraid of. Just an ordinary grizzly bear. Reward[edit] After killing the target, return to the Fighter Quester and he will say: "Good job, Loup-killer. Enjoy yer gold." If you also get the dungeon map he will add: "Here's a map to a place called (random dungeon). All the killing and treasure you can handle. Knock yourself out." Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] A successfully completed quest results in a reputation gain according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Fighters Guild +5   Fighter Questers +5   Associated factions +2 A failed quest results in a reputation loss according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Fighters Guild -2   Fighter Questers -2   Associated factions -1 (Allies/Enemies affiliations for listed factions are not considered in the tables.) Enemies[edit] Random dungeon monsters Quest Target: Any of the following One Grizzly Bear One Wereboar One Werewolf

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to the Fighter Quester of a Fighters Guild. Head to the dungeon where the spriggan can be found. Find the spriggan within the dungeon and kill it. (Optional) Find the spriggan and hit it once. Listen to the spriggan, and accept its proposal or kill it anyway. Deliver the spriggan's offer to the careless woodsman. Return to the Fighter Quester within the time limit for your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Tree Trimming[edit] The Fighter Quester says: "Some woodsmen have hired the guild to kill a spriggan. Seems the monster is attacking them when they are out in the woods logging. Want to take a hack at it (player's name)?" Accept[edit] The Fighter Quester goes on: "Two attempted ambushes have failed. The spriggan is just too smart. You'll have to go to its lair, in (dungeon). Get back to me within (time limit) days and I'll have (random gold) gold waiting for you." Decline[edit] The Fighter Quester answers: "Fair enough. Run along. I've got to find someone to take this job." Root Causes[edit] Travel to the dungeon the Fighter Quester mentioned and find the spriggan within. It will likely be the only one of its kind, since spriggans will only appear at lower levels. Once you have found the creature, hit it with a weak weapon or your fists once. Be careful not to use a strong weapon as it is easy to kill the spriggan with one hit, especially at higher levels. Once you have damaged the spriggan, it will say: "You attack me without cause, (player's race). Yes I did wreak vengeance upon the slayers of wood. Know that they did slay seedlings of mine. Would you stand rooted while someone slew your seedlings? I have no quarrel with you. Convince the woodsmen to prune with care, and I shall leave them in peace. Will you take this mission up?" You will now have to choose whether or not to agree to the spriggan's proposal. Refuse the Offer[edit] If you do not wish to accept the spriggan's offer, it says: "I should have known better than to trust a creature of flesh. Now I shall give you no quarter." The spriggan will continue to fight to the death. After you kill it (whether or not it made an offer), the following message will appear: The spriggan is dead. Those woodsmen can log in safety now. Accept the Offer[edit] The leader of the woodsmen If you accept the spriggan's offer, it will continue: "The main culprit is (woodsman's name), who hacks down trees without care. Go to (town) and secure his promise. Do not visit me again. I shall know of your success or failure by how the woodsman [sic] do their work." Travel to the town where the woodsman lives and ask around to learn his location. Enter his residence and talk to him, and he will say: "So the tree creature wants to cut a deal, eh? Well I suppose I can convince the boys to only log the big trees. But if his kind attack us again, we'll burn every sapling we can find! You've got yourself a deal, (player's name)." Reward[edit] Once you either kill the spriggan or get the woodsman to agree to its proposal, return to the Fighter Quester. If you killed the spriggan, he will say: "The spriggan is kindling? You are proving yourself to be quite reliable, (player's guild rank). Here is your (random gold) gold as promised." If you accepted the spriggan's offer, he will say: "You worked it so the woodsmen and the spriggan ain't fightin'? Very clever (player's name). You'll go far if you keep those wits sharp." There is also a 50% chance the Fighter Quester also gives you a dungeon map, saying: "By the way, since I'm feelin' charitable, here's a map to a hole called (dungeon). Full of monsters needin' killing, treasure to loot, the works. Have fun." Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] A successfully completed quest results in a reputation gain according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Fighters Guild +5   Fighter Questers +5   Associated factions +2 A failed quest results in a reputation loss according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Fighters Guild -2   Fighter Questers -2   Associated factions -1 (Allies/Enemies affiliations for listed factions are not considered in the tables.) Additional Reputation[edit] If you accept the spriggan's proposal and talk to the woodsman, you will gain additional reputation according to the table below: Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Current Region +10   People of the Current Region +10   Current Region's associated factions +5

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to the Fighter Quester of a Fighters Guild. Head to the dungeon the Fighter Quester mentions to you. Find the atronach within and kill it. Return to the Fighter Quester within the time limit and collect your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: The pit and the flesh atronach Ice atronachs make for chilling encounters The iron atronach owns these dungeon halls  Elemental Fury[edit] Speak to a Fighter Quester, who says: "We have a new client who wants someone to hunt down an atronach, an elemental golem type critter. The pay is (random gold) gold. Are you interested?" Accept[edit] The Fighter Quester goes on: "A young dandy what I have sworn to keep unnamed, was screwing around with magic, illegally. Like a melonhead, he up and conjures an atronach. The thing's gotta be destroyed before those Mages Guild blokes find out. The thing fled into the depths of (dungeon). If you can do this quest in (time limit) days, you'll get paid." Decline[edit] The Fighter Quester answers: "You must prefer the low risk jobs, like hunting rats." Sending the Atronach Back to Oblivion[edit] This quest is a standard dungeon crawl. Travel to the dungeon the Fighter Quester mentioned and find the atronach within. The target can be any type of atronach, although there may be multiple atronachs of varying types depending on the dungeon and your level. Your target will always be found at a quest location, however. You will know you have completed the task when you receive the following message upon killing an atronach: The atronach is dead. Hopefully the Mages Guild won't find out about it. Reward[edit] Report back to the Fighter Quester after killing the atronach and he will say: "Bang-up job, (player's guild rank). Those Mages Guild bananas ain't wise to our client's shenanigans. He'll be happy to pay up the (random gold) gold pieces." There is a 25% chance the Fighter Quester also gives you a random dungeon map, adding: "And, since you was such a sport about it, here's a map to a place called (random dungeon) that's supposed to be chock full o' loot. Knock yerself out, (player's first name)." Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] A successfully completed quest results in a reputation gain according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Fighters Guild +5   Fighter Questers +5   Associated factions +2 A failed quest results in a reputation loss according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Fighters Guild -2   Fighter Questers -2   Associated factions -1 (Allies/Enemies affiliations for listed factions are not considered in the tables.)

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to the Fighter Quester of a Fighters Guild. Kill a barbarian in a local building. Report back to the Fighter Quester within the time limit.
Detailed Walkthrough: Barbarians Inside the Gate[edit] The Fighter Quester says: "I am (Fighter Quester's name). The Fighter's Guild doesn't hand out charity work. If I weren't short on fighter's [sic] right now, I'd have to send you away (player's name). I do need a fighter to chase off some barbarians that are running wild. Do it for me and I'll make sure everyone knows you're a stand up (player's race). Is it a deal?" Accept[edit] The Fighter Quester goes on: "Get your sorry carcass over to (building). Run off the barbarians by this time tomorrow and you'll be OK." Decline[edit] The Fighter Quester answers: "You've just make a big mistake (player's name). Don't come looking for work here for a while." Home Invasion[edit] This barbarian is causing trouble at the local tavern  Although this quest is a bit more challenging than other non-member quests, it should not cause you too much trouble. Despite the scenario the Fighter Quester describes, there will actually be only one barbarian for you to find. Enter the building, kill the target, and the following message pops up: The barbarian is dead. Loot the corpse if you wish. Like all combat class enemies, barbarians often carry a nice assortment of armor and weapons as well as a larger amount of gold, especially at higher levels. Reward[edit] Report back to the Fighters Guild after taking care of the barbarian. The Fighter Quester will say: "Did you get cut up bad? A couple more jobs like this and you can write your own ticket into the Fighter's Guild." The whole task must be done within a day, so be sure to return promptly. Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] A successfully completed quest results in a reputation gain according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Fighters Guild +5   Fighter Questers +5   Associated factions +2 A failed quest results in a reputation loss according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Fighters Guild -2   Fighter Questers -2   Associated factions -1 (Allies/Enemies affiliations for listed factions are not considered in the tables.) Enemies[edit] One Barbarian

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to the Fighter Quester of a Fighters Guild. Kill all rats or bats in the building in town. Report back to the Fighter Quester within the time limit.
Detailed Walkthrough: Bats (or Rats) in the Belfry[edit] The Fighter Quester says: "I am (Fighter Quester's name). I have a relatively menial job, if you are willing to take it. Actually, some members prefer these jobs because they pay just as well as the more difficult ones. A house here in town has infested by giant rodents. The wife claims they are rats, the husband claims they are bats. Either way, they want them gone. Are you interested?" Accept[edit] The Fighter Quester goes on: "The bats have infested (building). Go there and kill them all and you'll get your pay. I can only give you one day to finish this one." Decline[edit] The Fighter Quester answers: "Obviously you have no love for the Fighter's Guild. I will make sure to tell them what you really think." Exterminate the Infestation[edit] A giant bat terrifying readers a local library  This quest is almost identical to the non-member quest A Rat Infestation, but this time there can be either bats or rats at the building. Just head to the building in town and kill all rats or bats that appear. At every three in-game minutes there is a 60% chance that one creature will appear; there can be a maximum of seven altogether. When you have killed the last bat or rat, you get a notification: Thats [sic] most of them. The Fighters Guild won't quibble over the rest. Report back to the Fighter Quester once the building is clean. The whole task must be done within a day. Reward[edit] Upon your return after cleaning the building, the Fighter Quester will say: "Killing bats, even giant ones, doesn't take much skill, but it pays the same, eh?" Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] A successfully completed quest results in a reputation gain according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Fighters Guild +5   Fighter Questers +5   Associated factions +2 A failed quest results in a reputation loss according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Fighters Guild -2   Fighter Questers -2   Associated factions -1 (Allies/Enemies affiliations for listed factions are not considered in the tables.)
