Quick Walkthrough: Talk to the beldam of a Witch Coven. Escort the child to their hometown. Take care of any thugs along the way. Find the child's residence and take them home. Return to the beldam within the time limit for your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: The child's home Unknown forces are committed to preventing the child's safe return The Abandoned Child[edit] The beldam says: "The (witch coven) actually could use thy assistance in a most absurd and yet serious matter. Thou hast no illusions that the witches of (region) are despised. None trust us for long, for our power and solitude make us a difficult force to manipulate. We have discovered a trap that will soon be sprung on us, and we need someone like thee to disable it. Art thou interested in such a quest, in exchange for a (gem)?" Accept[edit] The beldam goes on: "Thou wilt? Take then this child, (child's name) (he/she) says (his/her) name is. We found (him/her) some days ago abandoned by (his/her) people. Clearly, (he/she) has been placed here so our enemies can prove that we are involved in -- what do you suppose? Human sacrifice? The corruption of innocents? Nothing so mundane as kidnapping I'd wager. (Child's name) tells us that (his/her) parents live at (residence) in (town). Lead the child back, but beware. Our fine enemies would rather murder the two of ye than allow the child to return home. Come back to us in (time limit) days or less and we'll have thy (gem) for thee. Good luck." Decline[edit] The beldam answers: "Wilt thou not? (Oath), the (witch coven) is used to the cowardice of our allies." Returning the Wayward Child[edit] As soon as the child is in your custody, you hear one of the following: "Witch lover! Child of (Daedra Prince)!" a voice shrieks. "Suffer not the Child of (Daedra Prince) and the (witch coven) to live!" someone screams. "(Random god) strengthen my hand against the pawn and the child of the infernal ones, the (witch coven)!" a voice cries. Besides this strange start, the quest is a pretty easy escort job. Just head to the town the child's parents live in, ask around town to locate their house, and drop the child off inside. The entrance door may be locked, so be prepared to pick the lock or have an Open spell handy. Beware, as you will be pursued by hostile warriors intent on killing both of you. Take care of any resistance and get the child into the house. As you enter, the child will say: "This is where I live! This is my home!" (Child's name) gives you a kiss on the cheek, "Thank you, (player's first name)!" Afterward, return to the Coven to collect your reward. Reward[edit] After returning to the Coven, the beldam tells you contentedly: "It is good that (child's name) is home. Perhaps the kindness that the (witch coven) showed will dispel some of the myths of our iniquity for the next generation. Here is thy (gem). Thanks be to thee, (player's first name)." If you rescue the child but fail to return before the time limit expires, the child leaves you, saying: "I'll go the rest of the way myself," says the child, slipping away and disappearing with surprising agility. Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] A successfully completed quest results in a reputation gain according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Witch Coven +5 A failed quest (time limit expired) results in a reputation loss according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Witch Coven -2 Enemies[edit] 40x One Warrior every fifteen in-game minutes once the quest begins

Quick Walkthrough: Pickpocket ten victims or alternatively pick six locked doors. Wait for about three days to receive a letter. Travel to the town mentioned in the letter Break into the residence and steal the clothing. Travel to the town mentioned in the note that comes with the clothing. Meet with the Thieves Guild contact and give him the clothing within the time limit to be accepted into the Thieves Guild.
Detailed Walkthrough: Prelude[edit] About three days after you successfully pickpocket ten civilians or enemies or pick a certain number of locks, you will receive a letter from a one-eyed beggar. The letter says: (Player's name), You are a thief. Do not try to deny it, you have  been seen in the act. There is honor among thieves. Either join the guild or face the consequences. Steal the (clothing) from (residence) in (first town) if you desire to join us. You have (time limit) days. Opportunity Makes A Thief[edit] The owner of the clothing won't be happy with you  Travel to the town mentioned in the letter and ask around to learn the location of the building. Depending on the time of the day and the type of building, the door may or may not be locked. If the door is locked, you will need to break in, so make sure you can cast an open spell if you can't pick the lock. The item is hiding in a pile of clothing lying on the floor somewhere within, pick it up to receive the following message: As you pick up the (clothing) you hear the soft rustle of paper. A note is tucked inside the (clothing). It reads: {Thieves Guild contact) (second town) After breaking into the house, the owner of the clothing (a mage) may show up and attack you. If you attack the mage, he will say: "Thief! I'll teach you to steal from a wizard. It will be a lesson you won't soon forget!" Reward[edit] The contact of the Thieves Guild Travel to the town mentioned in the note, and ask around until you know the contact's location. Deliver the stolen clothing to the contact, who says: "Another initiate. Sometimes I wonder if the guild can hold them all. Ah, I see they sent you after a mage's (clothing). It's a popular choice of late. You are now a member of the Thieves Guild. Whenever you enter a town, you will know if there are any guild buildings there. Unfortunately guild rules say I have to pay you for this worthless piece of trash because you stole it in the service of the guild. Here's a gold piece. Oh, I almost forgot. You are also entitled to a dungeon map. Here, let me show you where (dungeon name) is on yours." As the contact said, the location of every Thieves Guild guildhall will now be marked on your map. Seek one out for more quests and guild perks. Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] A successfully completed task will gain you no reputation. If you ignore the letter, the quest will count as a failure once the time limit expires. A failed quest results in a reputation loss according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Oblivion and all associated Daedra Princes +1   Sheogorath -1   The Night Mother +1   The Dark Brotherhood and its associated factions +1   Ebonarm -1   The Order of Arkay and its associated factions -1   The Benevolence of Mara and its associated factions -1   The Akatosh Chantry and its associated factions -1   The School of Julianos and its associated factions +1   The House of Dibella and its associated factions -1   The Temple of Stendarr and its associated factions +1   The Mages Guild and its associated factions -1   The Thieves Guild and its associated factions +1   Random Ruler -1   Daggerfall and its associated factions -1   Sentinel and its associated factions -1   Wayrest and its associated factions -1   The King of Worms and The Necromancers -1   The Underking and his Agents -1   Orsinium and its associated factions -1   The Glenmoril Witches -1   The Dust Witches +1   The Daughters of Wroth +1   The Witches of the Marsh +1   The Beldama +1   The Tide Witches +1   The Merchants -1   The Bards -1   The Prostitutes -1   Wrothgarian Mountains and its associated factions +1 (Allies/Enemies affiliations for listed factions are not considered.) If you fail the quest, you will never be able to join the Thieves Guild. Enemies[edit] 3x One Mage every three in-game minutes (25% chance) once you enter the mage's house

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to a Merchant or an Innkeeper. Travel to the town specified by your employer. Head to the building where your contact is waiting. Pay the ransom, or: (Optional) Travel to the victim's dungeon and find him/her within. Bring the victim back to your employer within the time limit and collect your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Missing Lover[edit] Speak to a merchant or innkeeper, who says: "My poor darling (victim's name) has been kidnapped by the Thieves Guild. Could you help me?" or "The Thieves Guild has taken my dearest (victim's name) away from me and now they're demanding a ransom. I need someone to bring my lover back to me, any way they can. Please, will you help me?" Accept[edit] The merchant or innkeeper goes on: "I can't pay you very much, (player's first name). I used most of my gold to buy this gem for the ransom, but you can have the remainder of my savings, (very little random gold) gold pieces, when my dearest (victim's name) is back with me. The kidnappers want the (gemstone) to be delivered to (tavern's name) in (town) and I am to take no longer than (time limit) days. At (tavern's name), I am to look for a (negotiator's description), whose name's (negotiator's name). Nothing matters but (victim's name)'s safety, but if you ensure that without paying the ransom, I'll be very grateful. Like I said, it's all I have. Good luck and may (random god) Bless You." or "Thank (random god). Here's the (gemstone) the kidnappers want for ransom. If you can find a way to rescue (victim's name) without paying the ransom, I would be very grateful. After buying that gem, my savings is almost entirely gone. You can, of course, have (very little random gold) gold, once (victim's name) has returned -- that will make my life savings gone entirely, but it'll be worth it. If the ransom must be paid, be sure to take no more than (time limit) days to do it. The kidnappers have an agent in (tavern's name) over in (town), a (negotiator's description) named (negotiator's name). Once (time limit) days have passed, (he/she) will send word to (his/her) friends wherever they're keeping (victim's name) and they'll kill (him/her). Please don't let that happen. Good luck, friend." Decline[edit] The merchant or innkeeper answers: "You have a cold heart, (player's first name). I guess I will have to face these kidnappers on my own." or "Then I'll find someone else, (player's name)." Ransom or Rescue[edit] The negotiator speaks for the Thieves Guild Head to the specified town and building. Go inside and speak to the Thieves Guild's negotiator. If your reputation with the Thieves Guild is less than 10, you will receive a prompt asking if you want to hand over the gem. However, if your reputation with the Guild is greater than 10, the negotiator recognizes you and says: "You're (player's first name), aintcha? The Thieves Guild's fond of you, kid. Oh, (oath), I see. You're working for (employer's name) to make sure (he/she) pays us with no funny stuff, right?" Make your choice. Pay the ransom[edit] If you have a low reputation with the Thieves Guild, the negotiator says: "Ah, good. Let (employer's name) know that (his/her) (victim's name) will be safe in (town) very shortly. Farewell." If you are on good terms with the Guild, you hear: "No wonder the Guild likes you. I'll make sure they hear about this too, (player's first name). Now, go on back to (employer's name) and tell (him/her) that (victim's name) will be there shortly. Nice doing business with you." True to its word, the Thieves Guild sets the victim free. Additionally, if your reputation with the Thieves Guild exceeds 10, you even get to keep the gem because they like you so much. Head back to your employer to learn that all is well and collect your meager reward. Don't pay the ransom[edit] Cross the Guild and they'll send a thug after you The hijacked victim  If you refuse to hand over the gemstone, the negotiator angrily says: (Victim's  name) will pay for your stupidity! (Oath), (he/she)'ll be dead before (time limit) days have passed! (Thug's name)! Rip this (player's race) apart!" or "(Thug's name)! Kill this very stupid (player's race) while I do the same to (victim's name)." The negotiator vanishes, and a Thieves Guild thug, a rogue, enters the building to attack you. Kill the thug and loot the corpse to find a note, which gives you the victim's location: (Thug's name),      The Guild could use your muscle on a fairly routine kidnapping. The name of the victim is (victim's name) and after you've taken (him/her) from (his/her) home in (employer's building) in (employer's town), go to (dungeon).      Directions to (dungeon) follow. I hope this isn't too difficult a plan for you. (Negotiator's name) The remainder of this path is a dungeon crawl; head to the dungeon and find the victim within, who says when found: "(Employer's name) sent you? (Oath), thank (god's name)! Quick, let's get out here!" Escort the victim back to your employer. If you have the gemstone in your possession when you return, you will gain additional reputation with your employer's faction, but lose reputation with the Thieves Guild. However, you do not get to keep the gem after completing the quest; you will only get the meager reward and the reputation bonuses. Reward[edit] If you paid the ransom, your employer says: "Yes, (victim's name) was delivered just before you arrived, (player's first name). Thank you for facing that dreadful (negotiator's name) for me. Here is the (very little random gold) gold pieces I promised you." If you rescue the victim from the dungeon and return with the gem, your employer takes the gem back and says: "(Victim's name)! Oh, thank (god's name) you're alive. And, good (player's first name), you didn't even use the ransom (gemstone). I cannot thank you enough. Here is the (very little random gold) gold I promised, but it is hardly enough. You have my deepest gratitude, my friend." If you rescue the victim from the dungeon and return without the gem, your employer says: "(Victim's name)! Thank (god's name) you're all right! Thank you, my friend. I wish you didn't have to pay the ransom, (player's first name), but it's most important that my dear (victim's name) is back. Here is the (very little random gold) gold pieces I promised." After any of these, your employer gives you your modest reward, saying: "Take it. It's yours my friend." If the time limit expires before you can pay the ransom or rescue the victim, a message appears: By now, (victim's name) is surely dead. If the time limit expires after you rescue the victim, but fail to return to your employer in time: (Victim's name) tells you (he/she) can find (his/her) way to (his/her) lover (employer's name) from here, thanks you, and sprints away. In either case, if the time limit expires you fail the quest and lose reputation with your employer's faction. However, you get to keep the ransom gem as it will not disappear from your inventory. Additionally, regardless of how you handled the Thieves Guild you will not lose any reputation with them for an expired time limit. Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] A successfully completed quest results in a reputation gain according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Questgiver's faction +5   Questgiver's associated factions +2 A failed quest (time limit expired) results in a reputation loss according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Questgiver's faction -2   Questgiver's associated factions -1 In addition you will lose reputation as seen below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Questgivers's faction -5   Questgivers's associated faction -2 Additional Reputation[edit] If you free the victim and come back with the gem, you will gain/lose additional reputation according to the table below: Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Employer's faction +15   Employer's associated faction +8   Thieves Guild -10   Thieves Guild's associated factions -5 If you free the victim but come back without the gem, you will gain additional reputation according to the table below: Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Employer's faction +8   Employer's associated faction +4 Enemies[edit] Random dungeon monsters One Rogue, if you refuse to give the gem to the Thieves Guild's contact

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to a Merchant or an Innkeeper. Travel to the dungeon your employer mentioned to you. Find and retrieve the book. Bring it back to your employer within the time limit. Collect the remainder of your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Advance Offer[edit] Speak to a merchant or innkeeper, who says: "You've heard of (book title)? It is a very rare tome, almost never seen, but I have located a copy buried away in a dungeon here in (region). I will give you (upfront gold) gold pieces now and (random gold) gold once the book is in my hands. Agreed?" or "I am looking for a very special book, one that is not available in any store, at least not for any price less than astronomical. Recently, I have heard that a copy of it has surfaced not too far from here, in a dungeon. If you will accept this quest to find this tome, I will give you (upfront gold) gold pieces now and another (random gold) gold pieces when you return. Do we have a deal then, (player's first name)?" Accept[edit] The Merchant or Innkeeper goes on: "Good. I'll give you (time limit) days to get the book out of (dungeon) and return. After that time, the (random gold) gold pieces will be forfeit. The name of the book is (book title). Good luck, (player's first name)." Decline[edit] The Merchant or Innkeeper answers: "Very well. I'll look for a different mercenary then." Recover the Book[edit] Of course, the book couldn't be found in a library somewhere... The book, in a cozy dungeon reading nook  Receive your little upfront gold and head to the dungeon your employer mentioned. Just find the book within and retrieve it. You will get a notification when you pick up the correct one: You picked up (book title). Head back to your employer to deliver the book and collect your reward. Reward[edit] When you return with the book, your employer says: "Ah, marvelous. Here's the (random gold) gold pieces I promised. Thank you very much, (player's first name)." If you take too long and the time limit runs out, you get the following message: (Employer's name) will be angry. This is past the time when you were to bring (him/her) the book. If you have recovered the book before the time limit expires, it remains in your inventory and you may do with it as you wish. Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] A successfully completed quest results in a reputation gain according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Questgiver's faction +5   Questgiver's associated factions +2 A failed quest (time limit expired) results in a reputation loss according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Questgiver's faction -2   Questgiver's associated factions -1 Enemies[edit] Random dungeon monsters

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to a Noble. Head to the town where the alchemist is located. Give the turquoise to the alchemist. In return, get the ingredient the noble wants. Return the ingredient to the noble within the time limit for your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Alchemist's shop The alchemist preparing an experiment  Experimental Needs[edit] Speak to a noble, who says: "How would you like to have a lovely (gem) from my treasury, (player's first name)? My alchemist has ordered a very rare ingredient he needs for an important experiment and we need someone to pick it up. Do you think you could handle that, (player's first name)?" Accept[edit] The noble goes on: "Excellent, (player's first name), I knew you would be game. Take this turquoise down to (alchemist's shop) in (town). There's a (alchemist's description) there by the name of (alchemist's name). Ask (him/her) to give you the (ingredient) (he/she)'s brought up from the south. Make sure you're there and back in (time limit) days. All righty then, (player's first name). I'm relying on you. Don't make me regret it." Decline[edit] The noble answers: "Well, that's odd. You might try not to have such a mercenary's heart, (player's first name)." Alchemical Necessities[edit] This quest is a simple delivery for the noble, you will encounter no enemies on your way. Travel to the city where the alchemist resides and find their shop. Enter it and deliver the turquoise, and the alchemist will say: "And you must be (player's first name), sent by (noble's name), yes? Well, here's that (ingredient) (he/she) wanted. You better hurry back with it -- (his/her) alchemist has very strong feeling about the freshness of ingredients. Misplaced, of course. (Ingredient) doesn't spoil. Still, you know what they say about one man's poison ... Now hurry along." The alchemist gives you an ingredient in return. Bring the ingredient back to the noble within the time limit to collect your reward. Reward[edit] Upon delivering the ingredient, the noble will say to you: "Good timing, (player's first name). My alchemist will be so pleased -- it is a most excellent (ingredient). As I promised, here is your (gem). Pretty, isn't it?" Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] A successfully completed quest results in a reputation gain according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Noble you got the quest from +5   Noble's associated factions +2 If you don't return with the ingredient in time, you will lose reputation according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Noble you got the quest from -22   Noble's associated factions -11   Oblivion and all associated Daedra Princes +1   Sheogorath -1   The Night Mother +1   The Dark Brotherhood and its associated factions +1   Ebonarm -1   The Order of Arkay and its associated factions -1   The Benevolence of Mara and its associated factions -1   The Akatosh Chantry and its associated factions -1   The School of Julianos and its associated factions +1   The House of Dibella and its associated factions -1   The Temple of Stendarr and its associated factions +1   The Mages Guild and its associated factions -1   The Thieves Guild and its associated factions +1   Random Ruler -1   Daggerfall and its associated factions -1   Sentinel and its associated factions -1   Wayrest and its associated factions -1   The King of Worms and The Necromancers -1   The Underking and his Agents -1   Orsinium and its associated factions -1   The Glenmoril Witches -1   The Dust Witches +1   The Daughters of Wroth +1   The Witches of the Marsh +1   The Beldama +1   The Tide Witches +1   The Merchants -1   The Bards -1   The Prostitutes -1   Wrothgarian Mountains and its associated factions +1 (Allies/Enemies affiliations for listed factions are not considered.) Enemies[edit] None

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to the beldam of a witch coven. Head to the town which was mentioned to you. Meet your contact there and receive the book. Either fight the guard or make your escape. Return to the beldam within the time limit and collect your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Limited Edition[edit] The beldam says: "Yes, as a matter of fact, thou could help us, (player's first name). We are an isolated coven, viewed with fear and hostility in the outside world. If thou would procure for us a certain rare tome being held for us in (town), we would be happy to give you, say, a special (magical item) personally created for you." Accept[edit] The beldam goes on: "Wouldst thou? The name of the tome is (book title) -- a very rare book indeed. Even if one were to find a copy, the price would be quite prohibitive. We are lucky, therefore, to have a friend in (town), a (contact's description) named (contact's name) who has stolen a copy. If thou wouldst meet (him/her) at (building), (he/she) will give thee the book. We will expect thee back in (time limit) days. After that time, the book will be of no use to us. May (Daedra Prince) watch thy journey." Decline[edit] The beldam answers: "Well, then we shall wait for the next wandering traveler. Our need is not that desperate." Retrieving the Book[edit] A well-to-do merchant who has "acquired" the rare tome. However the guards are also looking for the tome.  A simple errand: travel to the town named by the beldam and meet your contact in a building there. Speak to the book thief and you will hear: "Awright, (player's first name), here's the book. Just watch yourself. The guards are combing (town) for that thing." As soon as you receive the book, someone shouts: "Stop! Thief!" The source of the shouting soon becomes apparent as a knight appears and attacks you. You can either stay and fight or make your escape; it makes no difference for the quest outcome. Bring the book back to the beldam (you may encounter more knights on your way back) and collect your reward. Reward[edit] After receiving the book the beldam says: "Ah, there it is. I hoped you had an opportunity to peruse the page, good (player's first name). You are not likely to find its like again very soon. Well, here is your (magical item)." If instead the time limit expires before you can return with the book, a message appears: It suddenly occurs to you that the witches expected the book at this very moment. Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] A successfully completed quest results in a reputation gain according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Witch Coven +5 A failed quest (time limit expired) results in a reputation loss according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Witch Coven -2 Additional Reputation[edit] When you get the tome from the contact your Regional Reputation will decrease by 30 points. Enemies[edit] 20x One Knight every twenty in-game minutes (50% chance) once you have the tome

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to a Fighter Quester of the Fighters Guild. Find the correct building in the current city and kill the rats. Report back to the Fighter Quester within the time limit.
Detailed Walkthrough: Rodent Problems[edit] The Fighter Quester says: "My name is (Fighter Quester's name). We only give jobs to guild members. However, from time to time there are jobs that are too menial for fighters of the guild to accept. I have one such job. If you take it, it will show that you really want to be on our good side. What do you say?" Accept[edit] The Fighter Quester goes on: "Giant rats have infested (building name). There may be as many as half a dozen of them. Go there and kill them all and I'll see what strings I can pull on your behalf. I can only give you one day." Decline[edit] The Fighter Quester answers: "Obviously you have no love for the Fighter's Guild. I will make sure to tell them what you really think." Rats in the Walls[edit] The rats of the Iliac Bay grow quite large  This quest is similar to the members-only quest Hunt for Giant Rodents, but the targets are always rats in this one. Head to the building in town and kill all rats that appear. At every five in-game minutes there is a 75% chance that one rat will appear; there can be a maximum of seven rats altogether. However, you will get no notification after you have killed all the rats that appear. This task must be done within a day, so return to the Fighter Quester promptly afterwards. Reward[edit] Upon returning after you cleaned the building, the Fighter Quester will say: "Killing rats, even giant ones, doesn't take much skill. It does put you in favor with us though. Good work." Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] A successfully completed quest results in a reputation gain according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Fighters Guild +5   Fighter Questers +5   Associated factions +2 A failed quest results in a reputation loss according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Fighters Guild -2   Fighter Questers -2   Associated factions -1 (Allies/Enemies affiliations for listed factions are not considered in the tables.) Enemies[edit] 7x One Rat every five in-game minutes (75% chance)

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to a Merchant or an Innkeeper. Travel to the dungeon you are pointed to. Find the former partner and take them captive. Return the prisoner to your employer within the time limit for your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Skipping Town[edit] Speak to a merchant or innkeeper, who says one of: "My former partner here at (current town), a (partner's class), has taken more than (his/her) fair share of our profits and run away from (current town). Now, I'm not the vengeful sort, but I would appreciate it if you would bring the (partner's class) back to me, so I can get some explanation for this remarkable behavior. I'll pay you (random gold) gold pieces for (him/her) alive, and (less random gold) gold if you accidentally kill (him/her)." "That damnable (partner's class) let me trust (him/her), led me merrily along, and then left without a word but with a sizeable portion of my savings. Now the money does bother me, but not as much as the betrayal. I want you to track (him/her) down, and bring (him/her) to me, and I'm willing to pay (random gold) gold pieces for it. Are you willing and able?" "I am looking for a manhunter, or, more specifically, a (partner's class) hunter. You see, (he/she) left town without paying the gold (he/she) owes me. It's the principle of the thing.I don't mind paying you (little random gold) gold pieces for (his/her) capture, but my reputation would be ruined if I let my debtors just leave (current town), owing me gold. Will you get this deadbeat for me?" Accept[edit] The merchant or innkeeper goes on: "Good. The (partner's class)'s name is (partner's name), and rumor has it that (he/she) is holed up in (dungeon) for (time limit) days at most. That will be the deadline by which I expect to hear from you. Remember -- (partner's name) is a tough (partner's class), so expect a fight, but try not to kill (him/her). I want (him/her) alive, not dead. Good luck, (player's first name)." "That's fine then. My sources tell me that the (partner's class) has taken refuge in (dungeon) and will probably be there for (time limit) days or so. I fully expect (partner's name), that's the (partner's class)'s name, to put up a fight, but try not to kill (him/her). I will expect you back in (time limit) days. Good luck." "Frightfully good of you, (player's first name). I've made some inquiries and it seems that our (partner's class) friend is lurking about the vicinity of (dungeon), unguarded and alone except for the usual brutes in residence. (Partner's name) is (his/her) name and I will expect (him/her) before me in (time limit) days, preferably alive. Don't disappoint me." Decline[edit] The merchant or innkeeper answers: "No? Well, I'll just go down to the Fighters Guild and hire someone else." or "That's too bad. Let me know if you change your mind." Retrieving the Runaway[edit] The ranger will not go without a fight Travel to the dungeon named by the quest giver and find your employer's partner within; he or she will be a ranger class enemy. Use a weapon which does a minimum of damage or use no weapon at all to hit the target a few times. When you have inflicted enough damage, he or she will surrender, saying: "Ow! (oath), I surrender!" or "I give up! I give up!" or "Don't kill me! I surrender!" If you are too forceful and kill the target, the following message pops up: (Employer's name) wanted (partner's name) alive, but you've slain (him/her). To complete this quest successfully, you must not kill the ranger. After the target surrenders, return to your employer. Reward[edit] When you report back with you prisoner your employer will say: "Ah, good day, (partner's name). It seems to me that we have some business to discuss, don't we? (Player's first name), I thank you for making this (partner's class)'s trip as comfortable as possible. Here is the (random gold) gold I promised." If you killed the target, your employer will say: "Well, I had wanted (partner's name) alive, but I suppose I would have killed (him/her) eventually myself. Here's (less random gold) gold pieces. Not the full amount, but I am appreciative." Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] A successfully completed quest results in a reputation gain according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Questgiver's faction +5   Questgiver's associated factions +2 A failed quest (time limit expired) results in a reputation loss according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Questgiver's faction -2   Questgiver's associated factions -1 Enemies[edit] Random dungeon monster Quest Target: One Ranger

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to the quest giver of your Temple. Head to the dungeon named by the quest giver. Find and retrieve the relic, (Optional) Destroy the lich. Bring the relic back to the quest giver within the time limit and collect your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Lich's Relic[edit] Speak to the quest giver, who says: "(Player's guild title), (temple) needs you for a dangerous mission to retrieve one of the lost (relic) of (temple's god). You will have to defy the power of (lich's name), its creator who then betrayed the temple and sank into evil. He is now a lich, and still guards the (relic). Are you willing?" Accept[edit] The quest giver goes on: "I admire your courage, but tremble to think of the danger you are about to face. (Lich's name) guards his (relic) of (temple's god) in (dungeon). Remember, there is no need to slay the lich, just retrieve the (relic) and return it to (temple) here. If we have no word from you in (time limit) days, we will chant the Song of the Departed for you. (Temple's god)'s blessings upon you, (player's name)." Decline[edit] The quest giver answers: "I understand. A lich is a fearsome opponent for one of your youth and inexperience. Perhaps as you mature you will take up this again. (Temple's god) go with you." Recovering the Lich's Relic[edit] Get the drop on the undead spellcaster  Head to the dungeon named by the quest giver, enter it, and find the relic within. When you pick up the relic, a confirmation appears: This is surely (temple)'s long-lost (relic). The relic will be found near its maker, the lich. If you wish to fight the creature, it may be easier to take care of him before attempting to recover the lost item, especially if he is in a small room. When you hit the lich after picking up the relic, he hisses in fury: "You dogs of (temple) will never have my (relic)! I made it and I will keep it. Nothing will stop me, not even the grave." After you destroy the lich and recover the relic, return to the Temple to collect your reward. Reward[edit] When you hand the relic over, the quest giver says: "Praise to great (temple's god)! I had not allowed myself to hope that you would actually succeed. (Temple's god)'s favor will surely shine upon you for this deed. As a small token of the Temple's gratitude, please accept this enchanted (magical item). If you destroyed the lich, the quest giver adds: "What? You not only retrieved the sacred (relic), but also killed the evil (lich's name)? You are truly one of (temple's god)'s favored ones. You will surely rise far in our order." If you retrieve the relic but the time limit expires before you can return to the quest giver, you see the following: A sinister voice whispers from nowhere, "The (relic) does not belong to you or the  sentimental fools of (temple). I therefore reclaim what is rightfully mine." The (relic) vanishes. Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] A successfully completed quest results in a reputation gain according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Deity of the Temple +5   Temple and its associated factions +2 A failed quest results in a reputation loss according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Deity of the Temple -2   Temple and its associated factions -1 Additional Reputation[edit] In case you also destroyed the lich, you will gain additional reputation as shown below: Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Deity of the Temple +7   Temple and its associated factions +3 Enemies[edit] Random dungeon monsters One Lich near the religious item

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to a Dark Slayer in a Dark Brotherhood guildhall. Head to the dungeon where your target is hiding. Find and kill the mage within. Return to the Dark Slayer within the time limit to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: Guild Business[edit] Speak to a Dark Slayer, who says: "The Mages Guild has come to us for a bit of messy business that's too gross and nasty for them to deal with. A renegade mage needs an accounting fast. Interested?" or "We have the Mages Guild for a client again. Seems that one of their boys has been sniffing too much bat gut, and has gone off on a rampage. Sound interesting, (player's guild title)?" Accept[edit] The Dark Slayer goes on: "Good. Now, this mage -- the name is (mage's name) -- has absconded with a number of magic thingies but the Mages Guild doesn't mind if you take whatever (he/she) has stolen. They just want (him/her) dead. And you've only got (time limit) days to bring in the accounting. You'll find (him/her) cowering down in a nasty place called (dungeon). Get back here with the world minus one rogue mage in (time limit) days. Mephala steady your arm, (player's guild title)." Decline[edit] The Dark Slayer answers: "That's disappointing." Snuffing the Spellcaster[edit] This is a standard dungeon crawl. Head to the dungeon where the mage is holed up and enter it. There may be multiple enemies of this type within, but you must kill the target for the quest to count as a success. When the renegade mage dies, you receive a notification: "(Mage's name)'s light is snuffed out. The Brotherhood and the Mages Guild will be pleased." Return to the guildhall to complete the quest. Reward[edit] Speak to the Dark Slayer after the mage is dead and he will say: "So, you put the spark out of that Sparkcaster, (player's first name)? Ah, Mephala is pleased with you, as are her children." Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] A successfully completed quest results in a reputation gain according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Dark Brotherhood +5   Dark Slayers +5   Associated factions +2 A failed quest results in a reputation loss according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Dark Brotherhood -2   Dark Slayers -2   Associated factions -1 (Allies/Enemies affiliations for listed factions are not considered in the tables) Enemies[edit] Random dungeon monsters Quest Target: One Mage

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to a Dark Slayer of the Dark Brotherhood. Head to the dungeon named by the Dark Slayer. Find and kill the traitor. Return to the Dark Slayer within the time limit to complete the quest.
Detailed Walkthrough: A Wolf in the Fold[edit] Speak to a Dark Slayer, who says: "There is a traitor in the Brotherhood. You will perform the necessary accounting on this liability, will you not?" or "From time to time, the Brotherhood is forced to do an accounting in our own books. A traitor has been found within our order who must be settled. You have been selected to do the honors." Accept[edit] The Dark Slayer goes on: "Very good. The traitor has taken refuge in (dungeon) to the (direction). If you have not returned in (time limit) days, your honor will be forfeit and another will take your place. Do not fail us in this, (player's first name)." Decline[edit] The Dark Slayer answers: "An ignoble reply. I expected better." Taking Down the Traitor[edit] This quest is a standard dungeon crawl. Head to the dungeon named by the quest giver, enter it, and find the traitor within. Your target will be an assassin, an acrobat, a battlemage, or a nightblade. There may by multiple enemies of these types in the dungeon, but you must kill the specified target to successfully complete the quest. When killed, the traitor leaves you with some parting words: "I am not...the traitor you...think I am. The...real traitor is..." The contract has been fulfilled. Return to the Dark Brotherhood to complete the quest Reward[edit] Upon your return after the traitor is dead, the Dark Slayer says: "Well done. You have reason to be proud." Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] A successfully completed quest results in a reputation gain according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Dark Brotherhood +5   Dark Slayers +5   Associated factions +2 A failed quest results in a reputation loss according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Dark Brotherhood -2   Dark Slayers -2   Associated factions -1 (Allies/Enemies affiliations for listed factions are not considered in the tables) Enemies[edit] Random dungeon monsters Quest Target: Any of the following One Acrobat One Assassin One Battlemage One Nightblade

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to the Guildmagister at a Mages Guild hall. Travel to the town the Guildmagister mentioned. Possibly receive a letter from the Dark Brotherhood. Meet the scholar and get their research notes. (Optional) Deliver the notes to the Dark Brotherhood, and possibly receive fake notes. Deliver the research notes (or fake notes) to the Guildmagister within the time limit.
Detailed Walkthrough: Dangerous Research[edit] Speak to the Guildmagister, who says: "As the premier research institution in the Empire of Tamriel, the Mages Guild employs a number of mystics and scholars all over the land. If we can get a representative of the Guild over to a place within a reasonable distance of here, the eminent scholar, (scholar's name), and [sic] has agreed to share (his/her) research. Would you be available for this?" or "The Mages Guild of (Guildmagister's town) has an exciting opportunity to benefit from the work of the renowned researcher and scholar, (scholar's name). (He/She) has agreed to donate some of (his/her) research to the Guild if we send someone to (scholar's town) to pick it up. Not surprisingly, (he/she) fears Necromancer intervention. I take it that you're as excited about this possibility as I am, (player's guild rank)?" Accept[edit] The Guildmagister goes on: "Grand, just grand. Now, (scholar's name) is staying in (scholar's town) in a place called (building) for just a few days. The danger is the Necromancers. Those reprobate spellslingers are interested in getting to (scholar's name) and (his/her) research. I will give you (time limit) days to get to (scholar's name) and back before I send someone else. Good luck." Decline[edit] The Guildmagister answers: "That's rather disappointing, (player's guild rank). If I were in better condition, I'd jump at the chance to meet the great (scholar's name). You're wasting your youth, (player's guild rank)." An Alternate Offer[edit] In truth, it is not the Necromancers who are after the research notes, but the Dark Brotherhood. If your reputation with the Brotherhood is less than or equal to ten, there is a 50% chance of getting a letter from them shortly after you start this quest. You should receive the letter at the latest one day after starting the quest. The letter reads: (Player's name), Do not make an enemy of the Dark Brotherhood. We can be great help to one another, but you could not wish for a worse enemy. When you have (scholar's name)'s research paper, bring it to me here at (contact's building) in (contact's town). Fail not, or the wrath of Mephala, Queen of Oblivion be on you. (Contact's name) If your reputation with the Brotherhood exceeds ten, you will always get a letter from them, with somewhat friendlier wording.  You should receive this letter about thirteen hours after you started the quest at most. This letter says: (Contact's building) (Contact's town) Dear Old (player's first name), Well done, (player's first name). (Scholar's name) was characteristically pigheaded about giving us (his/her) research notes, but (he/she)'d be pleased as a pumpkin to give it to a "representative" of the right-minded Mages Guild. You'll have a lovely bit of gold waiting for you here in (contact's town) when you get here with the notes. Yours, (Contact's name) Meeting the Scholar[edit] Travel to the town specified by the Guildmagister and locate the scholar, who says: "You're the (player's race) the Mages Guild sent over to protect my work, yes? Marvelous to meet you, my child. Here's the bally thing. Good luck getting past those infernal Necromancers with it. I certainly couldn't." The scholar hands you the research notes. If you received the Dark Brotherhood's letter, choose whether you want to accept the Brotherhood's offer or return the notes to the Mages Guild. In the latter case, simply return the notes to the Guildmagister and collect your gold. (Optional) Help the Dark Brotherhood[edit] The Dark Brotherhood appreciates your assistance in this matter If you want to accept the Dark Brotherhood's offer, travel to where the Brotherhood's contact is waiting for you. Ask around town until you know their location, enter the building and talk to the contact. Hand over the research notes, and the contact says: "What a thoughtful gift. I hope your Mages Guild pals aren't too upset about losing it. What would they know about practical application of dry research anyhow? Here, take (random gold) gold for your trouble. Buy yourself something nice." However, there is a 50% chance that the contact will also give you a fake copy of the original research notes, in which case they say: "How kind. The Dark Brotherhood would gratefully offer you (random gold) gold pieces for your service. In addition, here's a little something I whipped together that should keep you from getting in trouble with (Guildmagister's name) and the other Mages Guildmembers. All research notes look alike anyhow. When they don't yield results, the Guild will just throw more assistants at it or give up the project in embarassment [sic]. The Mages Guild is simply a tedious pack of researchers who don't have to worry about gold and thus are never happier than when they are doing pointless work." If you deliver these fake notes to the Mages Guild Guildmagister, you can still successfully complete the quest and receive your Mages Guild reward. If you are not given the fake notes, the quest counts as a failure once its time limit expires. Reward[edit] Return either of the two research notes and the Guildmagister says: "Oh, this is brilliant stuff. I guess those damned Necromancers were not too difficult to handle, at least, not for you. Spiffing job, (player's guild rank)." You receive a random amount of gold in return. Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] If you return any of the research notes to the Guildmagister, the quest counts as a success. Quick Walkthrough: Talk to the Guildmagister at a Mages Guild hall. Travel to the town the Guildmagister mentioned. Possibly receive a letter from the Dark Brotherhood. Meet the scholar and get their research notes. (Optional) Deliver the notes to the Dark Brotherhood, and possibly receive fake notes. Deliver the research notes (or fake notes) to the Guildmagister within the time limit.
Detailed Walkthrough: Dangerous Research[edit] Speak to the Guildmagister, who says: "As the premier research institution in the Empire of Tamriel, the Mages Guild employs a number of mystics and scholars all over the land. If we can get a representative of the Guild over to a place within a reasonable distance of here, the eminent scholar, (scholar's name), and [sic] has agreed to share (his/her) research. Would you be available for this?" or "The Mages Guild of (Guildmagister's town) has an exciting opportunity to benefit from the work of the renowned researcher and scholar, (scholar's name). (He/She) has agreed to donate some of (his/her) research to the Guild if we send someone to (scholar's town) to pick it up. Not surprisingly, (he/she) fears Necromancer intervention. I take it that you're as excited about this possibility as I am, (player's guild rank)?" Accept[edit] The Guildmagister goes on: "Grand, just grand. Now, (scholar's name) is staying in (scholar's town) in a place called (building) for just a few days. The danger is the Necromancers. Those reprobate spellslingers are interested in getting to (scholar's name) and (his/her) research. I will give you (time limit) days to get to (scholar's name) and back before I send someone else. Good luck." Decline[edit] The Guildmagister answers: "That's rather disappointing, (player's guild rank). If I were in better condition, I'd jump at the chance to meet the great (scholar's name). You're wasting your youth, (player's guild rank)." An Alternate Offer[edit] In truth, it is not the Necromancers who are after the research notes, but the Dark Brotherhood. If your reputation with the Brotherhood is less than or equal to ten, there is a 50% chance of getting a letter from them shortly after you start this quest. You should receive the letter at the latest one day after starting the quest. The letter reads: (Player's name), Do not make an enemy of the Dark Brotherhood. We can be great help to one another, but you could not wish for a worse enemy. When you have (scholar's name)'s research paper, bring it to me here at (contact's building) in (contact's town). Fail not, or the wrath of Mephala, Queen of Oblivion be on you. (Contact's name) If your reputation with the Brotherhood exceeds ten, you will always get a letter from them, with somewhat friendlier wording.  You should receive this letter about thirteen hours after you started the quest at most. This letter says: (Contact's building) (Contact's town) Dear Old (player's first name), Well done, (player's first name). (Scholar's name) was characteristically pigheaded about giving us (his/her) research notes, but (he/she)'d be pleased as a pumpkin to give it to a "representative" of the right-minded Mages Guild. You'll have a lovely bit of gold waiting for you here in (contact's town) when you get here with the notes. Yours, (Contact's name) Meeting the Scholar[edit] Travel to the town specified by the Guildmagister and locate the scholar, who says: "You're the (player's race) the Mages Guild sent over to protect my work, yes? Marvelous to meet you, my child. Here's the bally thing. Good luck getting past those infernal Necromancers with it. I certainly couldn't." The scholar hands you the research notes. If you received the Dark Brotherhood's letter, choose whether you want to accept the Brotherhood's offer or return the notes to the Mages Guild. In the latter case, simply return the notes to the Guildmagister and collect your gold. (Optional) Help the Dark Brotherhood[edit] The Dark Brotherhood appreciates your assistance in this matter If you want to accept the Dark Brotherhood's offer, travel to where the Brotherhood's contact is waiting for you. Ask around town until you know their location, enter the building and talk to the contact. Hand over the research notes, and the contact says: "What a thoughtful gift. I hope your Mages Guild pals aren't too upset about losing it. What would they know about practical application of dry research anyhow? Here, take (random gold) gold for your trouble. Buy yourself something nice." However, there is a 50% chance that the contact will also give you a fake copy of the original research notes, in which case they say: "How kind. The Dark Brotherhood would gratefully offer you (random gold) gold pieces for your service. In addition, here's a little something I whipped together that should keep you from getting in trouble with (Guildmagister's name) and the other Mages Guildmembers. All research notes look alike anyhow. When they don't yield results, the Guild will just throw more assistants at it or give up the project in embarassment [sic]. The Mages Guild is simply a tedious pack of researchers who don't have to worry about gold and thus are never happier than when they are doing pointless work." If you deliver these fake notes to the Mages Guild Guildmagister, you can still successfully complete the quest and receive your Mages Guild reward. If you are not given the fake notes, the quest counts as a failure once its time limit expires. Reward[edit] Return either of the two research notes and the Guildmagister says: "Oh, this is brilliant stuff. I guess those damned Necromancers were not too difficult to handle, at least, not for you. Spiffing job, (player's guild rank)." You receive a random amount of gold in return. Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] If you return any of the research notes to the Guildmagister, the quest counts as a success. Quick Walkthrough: Talk to a Quester of your Knightly Order. Head to the dungeon where the traitor is hiding. Find and kill the nightblade. Return to the Quester within the time limit.
Detailed Walkthrough: Perfidious Villainy[edit] Infiltrate the nightblade's hideout Be quick, for the nightblade is a powerful enemy  Speak to the Quester, who says: "We have a traitor in (town), a villainous Nightblade who has turned against (his/her) brethren. Our honor is at stake, (player's guild title). Join our righteous fury." or "(Knightly order) has been betrayed by a perfidious Nightblade. Will you help us track the cowardly villain down and destroy (him/her)?" Accept[edit] The Quester goes on: "Very good. The traitor is a Nightblade named (traitor's name) who has taken refuge in (dungeon) to the (direction). If you have not returned in (time limit) days, your honor will be forfeit and another will take your place. Do not fail us in this, (player's first name)." Decline[edit] The Quester answers: "An ignoble reply. I expected better." Deal With the Double-Dealing Defector[edit] This is a standard dungeon crawl. Go to the dungeon the Quester mentions to you and find the target, a nightblade. Nightblades are dangerous enemies who can attack from a distance with bows or up close with Destruction magic, so you may wish to bring potions of healing or magic resistance. There may be multiple nightblades within the dungeon, but when you have find and kill the traitor, you receive the following message: You have slain (traitor's name), the nightblade. Reward[edit] Upon your return, the Quester says: "Well done. You have reason to be proud." Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] A successfully completed quest results in a reputation gain according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Generic Knightly Order +5   Knight Order +5   City-State where the order is located -   Nobility of the city-state where the order is located -   People of the city-state where the order is located -   All other factions of the city-state where the order is located - A failed quest results in a reputation loss according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Generic Knightly Order -2   Knight Order -2  Enemies[edit] Random dungeon monsters Quest Target: One Nightblade

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to the Guildmagister at a Mages Guild hall. Travel to the dungeon the Guildmagister mentions to you. Find the ingredient and return it to the Guildmagister within the time limit for your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Note: You can only receive this quest if you are a member of the Mages Guild.  Non-members receive a similar but unrelated quest, namely Grab an Ingredient. The Missing Ingredient[edit] Speak to a Guildmagister, who says: "We need you to get a rare ingredient that is hidden away in a nearby dungeon. You will get a finder's fee of (random gold) gold pieces. Are you interested?" or "One of our more brilliant students is absolutely mad for something called (ingredient), which we haven't had much call for before. Would you, if it's not too much of a bother, scurry on over to this particular locale and grab some for us?" Accept[edit] The Guildmagister goes on: "An excellent attitude (player's first name). You are looking for (ingredient), which can be found in (dungeon). You have (time limit) days to bring it back." Decline[edit] The Guildmagister answers: "Humph. I hope the next guild member is more helpful." Recover the Reagent[edit] This quest is a standard dungeon crawl. Travel to the dungeon the Guildmagister mentioned and find the ingredient within. When you have found the ingredient in question, you will get a notification when you pick it up: This looks like the (ingredient) (Guildmagister's name) wanted. Bring it back to the Guildmagister and collect your reward. Reward[edit] Upon returning the ingredient to the Guildmagister, he or she will say: "I suppose this will do. Couldn't you have brought back a fresher sample? The quality of guild members just isn't what it used to be. Well, here is your finder's fee, (player's first name)." If you fail to return to the Guildmagister with the ingredient in time, a notification appears: You suddenly remember that (Guildmagister's name) had asked you to bring him a (ingredient) by today. (He/She) will no doubt be disappointed. If you found the ingredient but fail to deliver it before the time limit expires, you may keep it, although it will probably be a low value specimen. Quick Walkthrough: Talk to the quest giver at a Thieves Guild hall. Head to the town which was mentioned to you. Enter the building which was mentioned to you. Find and pick up the item you have come for. Make your escape. Return to the quest giver and collect your reward. Be sure to follow the time limit.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Merchant's Merchandise[edit] Speak to the quest giver, who says: "You can call me (quest giver's name). I have wind of some (rare item) that some pig of a merchant just bought. I want to you pinch it an bring it here. I'll pay you (random gold) gold. Are you interested?" Accept[edit] The quest giver goes on: "In (town) go to (building). It shouldn't be too tough to find the (rare item). Get it back to me in (time limit) days, and I'll pay you. No questions? Good." Decline[edit] The quest giver answers: "Move along (player's name). I need to find a thief worthy of the name." Pilfering the Merchant[edit] A rare pearl in the back room of a general store Head to the town where the Merchant does business. Ask around to find the correct shop and enter it. If you attempt to enter while the shop is closed, you will need to deal with the door being locked, so be prepared. The item will often be a pearl or chunk of ivory, find it within and grab it. Make your escape, but beware as you leave the building, as there may be a guard waiting for you at the entrance door, either a battlemage, an iron atronach, a daedra seducer or a werewolf. Kill the guard and return to the Thieves Guild. Reward[edit] When you give the stolen item to the quest giver he will say: "Oh ho! This shipment is better than I had thought. Here's your (random gold) gold (player's name). Don't spend it all on drink or vice." Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] A successfully completed quest results in a reputation gain according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Thieves Guild +5   Shadow Schemers +5   Associated factions +2 A failed quest results in a reputation loss according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Thieves Guild -2   Shadow Schemers -2   Associated factions -1 (Allies/Enemies affiliations for listed factions are not considered in the tables.) Enemies[edit] Any of the following: Battlemage (10% chance) Iron Atronach (10% chance) Daedra Seducer (10% chance) Werewolf (10% chance)

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to a Merchant or Innkeeper. Travel to the town your employer mentioned Find and talk to your employer's lover. Travel to the town where the lover's mentor's teacher lives. Find and speak to the teacher in a library. Head to the dungeon named by the teacher. Find and speak to the mentor in the named dungeon and get the answer. Return to your employer within the time limit (3 months) and collect your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: The lover appreciates the flowers in any case Next stop, the library The wisest teachers surround themselves with books The lover's mentor chose this place for the solitude The mentor has the answer you seek - just don't ask what the table is for  A Confounding Conundrum[edit] Speak to a merchant or innkeeper, who says: "I am (employer's name), and I need the services of a hunter of men. I am in love with (lover's name). Alas, (he/she) refuses to marry unless I prove my worthiness by answering a riddle (his/her) mentor (mentor's name) left behind when (he/she) vanished. I need you to find (him/her) and find the answer to (his/her) riddle. I will pay you (random gold) gold pieces if you succeed." Accept[edit] The merchant or innkeeper goes on: "The only person who might help you find (mentor's name) is (lover's name). (He/She) can be found in (lover's town). Take these flowers. They are (him/her [sic]) favorites. They may gain you some favor with (him/her). Here is a letter with (mentor's name)'s riddle inscribed upon it. If you have not returned in three months, I will assume that you have failed." Decline[edit] The merchant or innkeeper answers: "I will continue my search for an adventurer willing to take up my charge. If you meet anyone who would be interested in such a quest, direct them to (employer's name)." Solving the Riddle[edit] The letter containing the riddle can be found in your inventory. It reads as follows: Speak not of love or hate, but tell me this; what gift can you give to me, that I can never buy for myself? Even if you've already figured it out, you must still find the lover's mentor to confirm the answer. Unfortunately, the mentor is a bit of a hermit and not easily found. To begin your search, travel to the town where your employer's lover lives and ask around to discover their whereabouts. Once you have a building name, enter it and give the flowers to the lover, who says: "The (flowers) were not really necessary. (Mentor's name) left to study under the famous teacher (teacher's name) in (teacher's town). If you give (him/her) this book, (he/she) may look upon you favorably." The book will be a random title; once you have it, head for the teacher's town. Ask around to find the teacher's location, which will be a library. Find the teacher and deliver the book, and receive some information: "(Mentor's name) asked me not to reveal (his/her) whereabouts to strangers. However, since you bring (book title) from (lover's name) you are clearly not just some stranger. (Mentor's name) secluded (him/her)- self in a dungeon to study arcane lore. I have marked its location on your map. Good luck, (player's name)." The quest becomes a dungeon crawl at this point. Head to the dungeon the teacher directed you to and find the lover's mentor within. When you interrupt the mentor's study of arcane lore, you will be shouted at: "I hate being bothered! If the only way to get you to leave me alone is to give you the answer to that stupid riddle, then here, take it. Now get out of here before I summon a fire daedra to show you the way." Take another look at the note with the riddle on it, you will find it has been appended with the answer: Speak not of love or hate, but tell me this; what gift can you give to to me, that I can never buy for myself? -- It's KINDNESS, stupid! Now that you have the answer, head back to your employer, return the answered letter, and collect your reward. Reward[edit] Upon receiving the letter, your employer wastes no time getting to the answer: (Employer's name) rips open the letter from (mentor's name). "Kindness! Of course. Now I understand why (lover's name) sent me on this quest. It is not enough to love (him/her), I have to show (him/her) kindness as well. You have been most helpful, (player's first name). Here is the gold I promised you." Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] A successfully completed quest results in a reputation gain according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Questgiver's faction +5   Questgiver's associated factions +2 A failed quest (time limit expired) results in a reputation loss according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Questgiver's faction -2   Questgiver's associated factions -1 Enemies[edit] Random dungeon monsters

Quick Walkthrough: Become a vampire, then receive a letter. Travel to the dungeon mentioned in the letter. Find and destroy the vampire within. Meet with the vampire NPC mentioned in the letter within the time limit to collect your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: Your new "family" is waiting to welcome you A Mysterious Letter[edit] Once you have turned into a vampire you will receive a letter: Dear (player's name), For some time, we have watched you. In fact, we have watched you since you received the unholy blessing of vampirism. You have had your odd and awkward moments, but we are not displeased with the vampire you have become. The time has come for you to learn of your heritage, the proud lineage of (bloodline), the greatest of the vampiric bloodlines. To prove your allegiance, however, we require a sacrifice.      There is a haunt nearby where lodges a member of a lesser bloodline. Go to the place called (dungeon), and slay (vampire's name), this foul insult to our race. When the deed is completed, come to (building) in (town) and find me. I am instantly recognizable: look for a (vampire NPC's description). I will wait for (time limit) days, (player's first name). After that time, I will leave. I hope we do not miss one another. (Vampire NPC's name) The Sacrifice[edit] This quest is a standard dungeon crawl. Travel to the dungeon, which will be in the region where you received the letter. Once inside, find the vampire and kill it. There may be multiple vampires within, but when the target dies, you receive a notification: You have slain the vampire (vampire's name). Once the job is done, head to the town mentioned in the letter and meet the vampire who gave you the quest. Joining the Family[edit] Speak to the vampire after completing your mission and be told: "Excellent, (player's first name). You'll make a fine member of (bloodline). Welcome to the family. I am known as (vampire NPC's name). (Bloodline) will continue to watch your progress, and we may contact you from time to time on family business. Here is a ring that marks you as one of us." Quick Walkthrough: Talk to the quest giver of your Temple. Head to the dungeon named by the quest giver. Enter the dungeon and find the ingredient. Return to the quest giver within the time limit and collect your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Transgressing Temple[edit] Speak to a quest giver, who says: "They tell me that you quite loyal to the temple. I need you perform a vital task for us. (Temple's god) has become angry with us. You need not concern yourself with why. Our only hope is to hold a rite of atonement. We need (ingredient) for the ceremony. My sources tell me that some can be found in (dungeon). Will you bring it to us?" Accept[edit] The quest giver goes on: "The ceremony must be held within (time limit) days. The temple will reward you with (random gold) gold for this. Only untainted (ingredient) will do. (Temple's god)'s blessing is upon you so that you will know it when you find it." Decline[edit] The quest giver answers: "Your loyalty to the temple is not what I thought it was, (player's name)." Appeasing the Deity[edit] The ingredient will be laying around the dungeon somewhere, like this ectoplasm in a corridor  Once again, this quest is another standard dungeon crawl. Head to the dungeon mentioned by the quest giver and find the ingredient within. Pick it up and you will think to yourself: "This is it! I can feel the purity of the (ingredient). Now to get it back to (quest giver's name)." Return to the Temple and deliver the ingredient to the quest giver for your reward. Reward[edit] When you return with the ingredient, the quest giver will say: "You have it? (Ingredient)! (Temple's god) will be pacified. You have done well. Here is your reward." Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] A successfully completed quest results in a reputation gain according to the table below. Faction/Person Reputation Gain   Deity of the Temple -2   Temple and its associated factions -1 Enemies[edit] Random dungeon monsters

Quick Walkthrough: Talk to the Guildmagister at a Mages Guild hall. Travel to the city the Guildmagister mentioned. Enter the city's palace and kill the imp. Return to the Guildmagister within the time limit and collect your reward.
Detailed Walkthrough: The Imp Who Would Be King[edit] Speak to the Guildmagister, who says: "My name is (Guildmagister's name). We need someone to kill a rogue imp for us. Are you interested? The job does pay (random gold) gold." Accept[edit] The Guildmagister goes on: "Fine attitude (player's name). There is one thing I did not tell you. This imp was a familiar to a very high ranking mage. It seems the imp fell into an experimental spell and has been imbued with all manner of spell-like powers. You can find the creature at (palace) of (palace town). Apparently it thinks it is fit to rule. Do be careful (player's name). If you are not back within (time limit) days, we shall assume that you are dead." Decline[edit] The Guildmagister will answer with one of: "Too bad." "What a pity." "I see. Toddle off somewhere else then, (player's name)." Storming the Palace[edit] This quest is very simple. Travel to the given city, locate and enter the palace, then kill the imp. City palaces are frequently open from 10:00 to 18:00, though some are open at all hours. Imps are not normally tough enemies, but this one can cast some additional spells compared to a standard imp: Invisibility, Shield, Spell Shield and Troll's Blood. However, even with these additional spells it should not be a difficult fight. For thieves, there are crates in the palace filled with paintings that have some value. Reward[edit] Report back to the Guildmagister within the time limit and receive your reward. Once the imp has been taken care of, he says: "Tough little beggar, eh? Well you have certainly earned your pay." Reputation Gain/Loss[edit] A successfully completed quest results in a reputation gain according to the table below.
